title: Systemansvarig IT – applikationer för nät och anläggningar
description:
OM TJÄNSTEN
   

  

 Arbetsgivare: Svenska kraftnät Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, heltid
   

  

 Placeringsort: Sundbyberg, Stockholm
   

  

 Distansarbete: Upp till 50 % möjligt Sista ansökningsdag: 19 augusti 2025
   

  

 Kvalifikationer: Eftergymnasial utbildning inom teknik eller IT, minst tre års erfarenhet av system- och applikationsförvaltning, scriptning och protokoll, samt ITSM-processer. Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Meriterande: Goda kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet och IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

 Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med ny teknik ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

 Enheten Anläggningsinformationsstöd ingår i avdelningen IT för Nät och anläggningar. Avdelningen tillhör division IT och stöttar division Nät som har det samlade ansvaret för att bygga och förvalta kraftöverföringssystemet och dess anläggningar.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av Svenska kraftnäts digitaliseringsresa genom att ansvara för förvaltning och förbättring av ett flertal system som stödjer verksamheten inom området informationsstöd för nät och anläggningar.
   

  

 Du bidrar med djup förståelse för applikationerna och samarbetar nära uppdragsledare, IT-specialister, arkitekter och IT-säkerhetsspecialister. Tillsammans säkerställer ni att systemen möter morgondagens behov, håller hög kvalitet och är tillgängliga. De system som ingår i ditt ansvar har delvis höga säkerhetskrav och innefattar flertalet olika teknologier.
   

  

**Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter**
* Applikationsdrift (incidenthantering, problemhantering, underhåll).
* Ta fram och underhålla systemdokumentation.
* Ta fram underlag för rapportering, beslut och förvaltningsplan.
* Aktivt delta i förbättring av arbetssätt och systemdrift.
* Vid behov skapa script och hantera protokoll.
* Ta fram instruktioner för incidenthantering, paketering m.m.
* Samarbeta med verksamhet, leverantör och interna IT leverantörer för att lösa problem och incidenter samt för att planera för vidareutveckling.
* Underhålla informationen i ärendehanteringssystemen.
* Delta i risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser samt planera och hantera riskåtgärder.
* Säkerställa att säkerhetskrav uppfylls.


 Om dig
   

  

**Skallkrav**
 Vi söker dig som är samarbetsorienterad det vill säga anpassar dig och hittar lösningar genom ett prestigelöst fokus mot det gemensamma målet. För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är strukturerad och arbetar enligt en tydlig process, organiserar och planerar ditt arbete väl, slutför det som påbörjats och håller deadlines. Vi tror även att du har god problemlösningsförmåga och är resultatorienterad.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi att du har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom teknik, systemvetenskap, datavetenskap eller motsvarande utbildning. Du har även:
   

  

* Minst tre års aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av system- och applikationsförvaltning.
* Erfarenhet av att skapa script och hantera protokoll.
* Erfarenhet av ITSM processer (IT Service Management).
* God förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har goda kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet och IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm / Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 19 augusti 2025. Vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät

Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010-475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim ST, 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se

 Övrig information

title: DevOps Engineer with an interest in Machine Learning | SEB, Sweden
description:
*Ready to blend your DevOps expertise with the exciting world of Machine Learning? Join us in shaping the future of finance!*
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we’re innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you’ll be interested in this opportunity!*
**About The Role**
 As a DevOps Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, building, and maintaining our Machine Learning infrastructure. You will leverage Infrastructure as Code principles with Terraform to automate provisioning and management across our GCP environment. Your daily work includes streamlining deployment pipelines for Machine Learning models using Kubernetes and GitOps. Furthermore, the technical, communication and collaboration skills are equally important. Writing scripts in Python to automate tasks and implement test automation using principles of TDD, BDD, and DDD will be essential. You will also work with Linux systems, ensuring their security, stability and optimal performance.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience with cloud platforms, particularly GCP, and a deep understanding of Infrastructure as Code using Terraform.
* Strong scripting skills in Python or Bash and a solid understanding of Linux environments.
* Hands-on experience with containerization and GitOps for continuous delivery.
* A passion for Test automation and a good understanding of TDD and BDD practices.
* Strong understanding of security best practices


**Nice To Have Skills**
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes
* Previous experience in the financial domain


**What We Offer**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Remote working possibilities and flexible work schedule
* Numerous examples of innovative initiatives such as Innovation Hubs, SEBx, Ted Talks, Design Sprint Week etc.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than
 **2025-07-30.** 
 If you have questions about the position, please contact Dina Dervisevic, dina.dervisevic@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Director, Rapidly Growing Technology Investor, Stockholm, Sweden
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**About Our Client**
 Our client is a pan-European technology focused private equity investor investing across both services and software. They have built an enviable track record with their latest fundraising and realisations. With ambitions to grow their Nordic capabilities, they are now looking to add a seasoned investment professional to help build out the Nordic investment team in Stockholm.
   

  

**What the job involves**
* Work on all aspects of the transaction process from origination, deal structuring, negotiation, execution, portfolio management, and realisation
* Make investment decisions with a high degree of autonomy, and work closely with other senior team members across the fund


**Who we are looking for**
* Prior private equity experience is essential, with experience in a high performing environment developing analytical skills and commercial acumen
* A growing track record of successful technology deals in a deal captain capacity
* Other backgrounds in leading organisations may also be relevant, especially technology led ones
* Excellent academics including a degree at Bachelor or Master's level
* A credible and engaging presentational style, coupled with the confidence to be effective in relationship building with vendors / management teams and advisers
* High level of numeracy and technical proficiency, combined with the commercial awareness to put the numbers into their strategic context; and
* A demonstrable interest in investing in high growth technology businesses, coupled with a genuine interest in understanding underlying market and business dynamics

title: IT-Projektledare Elmarknadsapplikationer
description:
OM TJÄNSTEN
   

  

 Arbetsgivare: Svenska kraftnät Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, heltid
   

  

 Placeringsort: Sundbyberg, Stockholm Distansarbete: Upp till 50 % möjligt
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 25 augusti 2025
   

  

 Kvalifikationer: Högskoleutbildning inom IT, data eller systemvetenskap. Flerårig erfarenhet som IT-projektledare, vana att leda verksamhetskritiska IT-projekt i komplex miljö. Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Meriterande: Projektledningscertifiering (t.ex. PPS eller Prince2), erfarenhet av kravställning, införande av affärssystem samt förändringsledning.
   

  

 Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med ny teknik ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Som IT-projektledare arbetar du tillsammans med medarbetare inom IT och övrig verksamhet. Du projektleder inom IT-förvaltning, IT-utveckling, införande av nya IT-system och digitalisering av verksamheten. Som stöd har du projektmodellen PPS som i delar är anpassad till Svenska kraftnäts behov. Utöver PPS styrs vi som statligt affärsverk av riktlinjer, anvisningar och instruktioner.
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra enheten Elmarknadsapplikationer på IT-divisionen. Enheten ansvarar för applikationer som styr bud, balansering och avräkning på el-marknaden. Vi kommer tillsammans med övriga överföringssystemoperatörer i Norden och Europa inom de närmaste åren genomföra stora förändringar inom IT och digitalisering på el-marknaden. Rollen innebär att bli en del i transformationen.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Planera, leda, samordna och administrera projektet genom alla projektfaser samt lämna över till förvaltningsorganisation.
* Stötta projektägare/beställare i att fram projektdirektiv och underlag enligt Svenska kraftnäts anvisningar samt styr- och projektmodeller.
* Driva aktiviteter och löpande rapportera framdrift och risker till styrgrupp samt löpande informera olika intressentgrupper.
* Ansvara för projektets budget och resursallokering.
* Hantera leverantörer och leverantörskontakter.
* Vid behov upphandla enligt Svenska kraftnäts direktiv och processer (t ex LOU).
* Bidra till förvaltningsplanen och budgetprocessen.


 Om dig
   

  

**Skallkrav**
 Vi söker dig som skapar tillit, förtroende och goda relationer. Du kan hantera många kontaktytor, förstår vikten av gott samarbete och att framdrift skapas tillsammans med övrig verksamhet i samverkan. Vidare är du resultatinriktad, strukturerad och noggrann i ditt arbetssätt, tar gärna initiativ och du trivs i en föränderlig organisation som växer. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare Ser Vi Att Du Har Högskole-/universitetsutbildning (120p/180hp) Inom IT, Data Eller Systemvetenskap Eller Motsvarande Kompetens Förvärvad På Annat Sätt. Du Har Även
   

  

* Flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att arbeta som IT-projektledare.
* Aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att arbeta med verksamhetskritiska IT-system med höga krav på informationssäkerhet i en komplex IT-miljö.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Vi Ser Det Som Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Certifikat inom projektledning t ex PPS, Prince2 eller XLPM.
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram funktionella och icke funktionella krav.
* Erfarenhet av att leda införandet av informations- eller affärssystem.
* Erfarenhet av strukturerad förändringsledning, tex ADKAR.


 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg, Stockholm
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-08-25. Vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


 Kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Per Lundblad, tel. nr. 072-560 15 01 alternativt ansvarig rekryterare Maria Sahlén, tel. nr. 010-489 20 27 (maria.sahlen2@svk.se). Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim ST, 010 475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

 Under semestertider nås vi på mail och svarstiden kan vara längre än vanligt.
   

  

 Jobba här – bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. title: Digital Strategy & Transformation Specialist
job_function: Business Development, General Business, and Management
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Do you want to be part of the engine powering Saab’s digital transformation? Join Group Digitalisation and the Digital Strategy & Acceleration team. If you thrive where analysis meets communication and delivery, this role is for you. Step into a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your work shapes the future of technology and strategy.*
 Your role
   

  

 The Digital Strategy & Acceleration team is at the forefront of Saab’s digital transformation, driving innovation with a strong focus on delivery speed, adaptability, and long-term business value.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll support the ongoing development and execution of Saab’s digital strategy. Working closely with senior colleagues and cross-functional teams, you’ll contribute to strategic analysis, roadmap development and the design of governance models that bring clarity, insight, and measurable progress across the transformation journey.
   

  

 You’ll also help maintain high-quality strategy documentation, tailored to different audiences, and support communication efforts across the organisation. With your ability to handle data, translate insights into clear materials, and move fluidly between details and the bigger picture, you will help ensure momentum and alignment in a complex, fast-evolving landscape.
   

  

 Location is flexible and can be decided upon agreement.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 We’re looking for someone with strong analytical skills, excellent communication abilities, and a natural curiosity for how digital technologies can shape and improve complex organisations. You’re comfortable using modern digital tools and have experience conducting structured analyses that support strategic decision-making. You take initiative, adapt quickly, and thrive when working collaboratively across functions.
   

  

 Requirements:
   

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering, science, business development, finance, or a related field.
* At least 3 years of professional experience, including 2–3 years focused on Digital Strategy, Product Management, or Transformation Management within a Strategy & Transformation function in a larger organisation or in a leading management consulting firm.
* Proven exposure to digitally driven transformations, with emphasis on strategy design, roadmap development, and value realisation tracking.
* Industry experience in engineered products and/or the defense sector is highly desirable.
* Proven ability to structure and carry out strategic analyses that help shape and strengthen both current and future digital strategies.
* Experience in designing & maintaining digital transformation roadmaps and implementing governance and follow-up structures to ensure delivery against business outcomes.
* Extensive expertise in quantitative and qualitative data analysis and strategy documentation using fit-for-purpose tools.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*

title: Data Engineering Trainee
description:
Hey there! Are you our next Leadstar?
 



 Take the chance of a lifetime and join a market-leading, fast-paced team in the sports betting affiliate industry!
 



 We offer you:
 


* The opportunity to become an expert within data and the tools that power modern analytics
* The freedom to test your ideas and build data infrastructure that scales
* The prospect to grow within the company and take on more responsibilities
* A workplace where Mondays feel like Fridays



  





 What we want in return:
 


* A high level of commitment
* An eagerness to learn and become the best at what you do
* Smartness and curiosity about data
* A positive, solution-oriented mindset



  





 Who are we looking for?
 



  





 We are looking for a Data Engineering Trainee who will help us build, optimize, and maintain the systems that make our data flow reliably and efficiently.
 



 You are someone who wants to dive deep into data and analytics infrastructure and make sure our systems are clean, scalable, and high-performing.
 



 You don’t need to be a senior developer, but we want you to be hungry to learn. If you already have some experience with SQL or Python or any tool to process or visualize data, that’s a big plus. If not, we expect you to be excited to learn and become an expert over time.
 



 It’s also a plus if you have an interest in data, statistics, building data products or strategic thinking — but your drive and willingness to learn is what matters most.
 



  





 Job description
 



 The position as a Data Engineering Trainee is a full-time role for candidates based in Sweden.
 



 Your main task is to develop and secure our data systems to ensure clean, reliable, and scalable data - this includes:
 


* Responsibility for maintaining our databases and data pipelines from current tracking systems and data sources
* Optimizing existing data pipelines and streamlining our data flow
* Building new connections and data integrations with additional data sources



  





 There’s no limit to how much you can learn and grow in this role — it’s all up to your ambition and passion for data.
 



  





  





 About Leadstar Media
 



  





 Leadstar Media is a fast growing Swedish scale-up company that operates several websites within the sports betting industry. Today the company consists of over 70 employees and full-time consultants as well as several part-time freelancers. We are an international company with around 30 different nationalities represented and a presence in over 30 different geographical markets. Leadstar Media’s ambition is to create exceptional products for our visitors and to become the no. 1 sports betting affiliate in the world. We believe that the best way to achieve this is by having a tight-knit team of creators with a high level of autonomy.
 



 At Leadstar Media you will work together with entrepreneurial individuals who are eager to learn everything about their particular field. We want you to have the same winner mindset as the rest of the team! In addition to work, we organise other activities outside of work-hours such as small events, company trips and kick-offs.
 



  





 At Leadstar Media you always have the opportunity to grow within the company and take on more responsibility. Several of our talents have grown to become true stars and leaders. We have learned that the most important skills you need for this job are an ambition to learn, and the ability to take on responsibility.
 



  





 More info
 



 Start: As soon as possible
 



 Contract: Full-time, with a 6-month probation period
 



 Location: Stockholm, Sweden (in-office)
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Manager, Finance & People Solutions ( IT)
description:
**Vend** 
 is home to the most trusted and visited online marketplaces in the Nordics – including FINN (Norway), Blocket (Sweden), DBA and Bilbasen (Denmark), and Tori and Oikotie (Finland). Every day, we help millions of people make life-changing decisions – to buy, sell, hire, or get hired – by creating trusted matches through smart technology, strong brands, and deep local expertise.
   

  

 We’re excited to expand our team and are looking for a skilled
 **Manager- Finance and People Solutions ( IT).** 
 You’ll join
 **Enterprise Operations,** 
 with the mission to provide innovative and secure IT Solutions to the employees and functions of Vend.
   

  

 You will act as a Service Manager and work closely with the business to ensure the critical Finance & People solutions are running smoothly and are continuously evolving with user and business needs.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Ensure Operational Excellence: Responsible for the Infrastructure, integrations and security for your applications. Collaborate with vendors, business and IT support to ensure day-to-day operations according to relevant policies, procedures and processes
* IT Service Management: We operate in an agile way and facilitate backlog management, ensuring transparency and collaboration. Represent the team in planning, decision-making forums, and cross-functional alignment meetings.
* Stakeholder Engagement, strategic planning and development Close collaboration with the business stakeholders and process owners to make sure that the Service Strategy, roadmap and architecture maximise business value.
* Financial control, compliance and governance: Communication with application vendors, handling procurement, managing licenses and agreements. Manage service pricing, system costs, monitor budget, including cost allocation and transfer in/outs. Ensure compliance policies and guidelines, f.ex GDPR and NIS2
* People management and leadership: As a manager for a great team across the nordics you are responsible for employee growth, development and engagement.


 WHO ARE YOU?
   

  

 You naturally create structure and drive progress toward clear goals.
   

  

 Proactive and self-driven, you communicate clearly and foster strong collaboration across teams. Your unpretentious, hands-on leadership builds team spirit and clarity. You’re driven to grow both people and operations, and thrive in dynamic, change-oriented environments.
   

  

* You have an academic education or equivalent experience, with at least 4-5 years of work experience in leadership positions as well as managing IT applications, application development, or other relevant areas.
* You have broad technical IT knowledge, ideally with experience in Financial or HR system administration, or integration solutions for eg: Workday, Dynamics 365
* ITIL certification as well as Agile experience is an advantage.
* Fluent in English: You master English fluently in both speaking and writing. Knowing Swedish and or Norwegian is an advantage.
* Some travel across our Nordic markets shall be expected as part of collaboration with local teams and our business areas.


**What We Offer**
* A key role in a strong and collaborative Enterprise Operations unit
* High degree of responsibility from day one, with continuous opportunities for learning and development
* A hybrid work setup and centrally located offices in Oslo/Stockholm
* Competitive compensation and benefits
* A people-first company culture built on trust, curiosity, and impact.


 GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!
   

  

 Apply by
 **4th August 2025** 
 . We’ll begin reviewing applications after Deadline.
   

  

 QUESTIONS?
   

  

**Katarina Rustas,** 
 Head of Group & Business Solutions, is happy to share more about the team, projects, or day-to-day work. Best reached at katarina.rustas@vend.com. For recruitment-related questions, please contact
 **Clayton Don Corda** 
 at clayton.don.corda@vend.com

title: Integrationsutvecklare - sökes till Accelerate at Iver
description:
*Nu letar vi efter nya medarbetare som vill vara med på vår resa. Som en del av Accelerate at Iver ligger du i teknikens absoluta framkant och arbetar med spännande digitaliserings- och transformationsprojekt hos marknadsledande kunder. Vi är idag över 300 konsulter som brinner för att realisera digitala möjligheter i molnet. Tillsammans med våra kunder stänger vi gapet mellan aspiration och framgångsrik implementation. Nu söker vi en Integrationsutvecklare som vill bli en del av Accelerate at Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Din roll** 
**på Accelerate at Iver?**
 Som integrationsutvecklare hos Accelerate at Iver kommer du att bidra till att bygga robusta, moderna och långsiktiga integrationslösningar. Lösningarna byggs främst på Microsoft-teknologi, både cloud och on-prem.
   

  

 Vi söker en social och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett stort driv och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken.
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av vårt team och bidra till att bygga framtidens integrationslösningar?
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Utveckling & Implementering: Erfarenhet av att ta fram teknisk och funktionell design för integrationslösningar. Samarbeta med integrationsarkitekter för att utveckla lösningar som uppfyller både verksamhetsmål och tekniska principer.
* Kodkvalitet & Optimering: Säkerställ högkvalitativ, underhållbar och återanvändbar kod. Förbättra befintliga integrationer för att uppnå bättre skalbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda.
* Samarbete: Arbeta självständigt eller i team tillsammans med bland annat projektledare, arkitekter, testare och produktägare.
* Support & Underhåll: Bidra till det löpande underhållet och utvecklingen av integrationslösningar.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Accelerate at Iver kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.
   

  

 Hos Accelerate at Iver får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med C#, .Net Core och Microservices i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.
   

  

 Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik.
   

  

 Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver får du ett antal fördelar som:
   

  

* En trygg och säker anställning
* Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Hälso & sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Pensions och försäkringsrådgivning
* Förmånsportal
* Timbank & volontärdag
* Medarbetar och familjeaktiviteter i olika former


**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
 Erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknologier som:
   

  

* C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework, XML, JSON, REST-APIer, Biceps
* Azure Integration Services: Logic Apps, Service Bus, Azure Functions, Azure API Management
* SQL Server, Azure SQL
* Azure, men meriterande med erfarenhet av andra plattformar såsom BizTalk, Mulesoft eller andra plattformar


 Kunskap om verktyg som Microsoft Visual Studio/Visual Studio Code, Postman, Git och Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Minst 2–4 års erfarenhet inom integrationsutveckling
   

  

 Du bör ha jobbat i agila team med scrum- eller kanban som arbetssätt, och vara van vid de olika rollerna och rollfördelningen som ett sådant arbetssätt innebär.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.
   

  

 Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!
   

  

 För denna position krävs Svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Accelerate at Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Forward Deployed Engineer at Bemlo (W22)
description:
**About Bemlo**
 Bemlo is a comprehensive AI-powered workforce management platform, purpose-built for healthcare and social care. At its core is automated scheduling that generates optimal rosters—meeting care demands while respecting staff preferences.
   

  

 Backed by top-tier investors from Silicon Valley, Bemlo has quickly established a strong presence in Sweden’s public sector. Today, we serve 8 of Sweden’s regions and a rapidly growing number of municipalities.
   

  

 We’re a small but passionate, smart, and fast-moving team, driven by a commitment to delivering innovative solutions and outstanding customer service.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Bemlo, we’re revolutionizing how healthcare providers manage scheduling and staffing challenges. By leveraging the latest in generative AI, we automate large parts of our customers’ workflows—freeing up time for them to focus on quality of care and meaningful change.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a smart and ambitious
 **Forward Deployed Engineer** 
 to lead the implementation of Bemlo for new customers.
   

  

 As a Forward Deployed Engineer, you’ll lead rollout projects, act as the primary point of contact during onboarding, and play a key role in both product and business development at Bemlo.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Own implementation projects from signed contract to full rollout across the customer’s organization.
* Drive product development in close collaboration with developers and existing customers.
* Work hands-on with customers to understand their workflows, identify high-value use cases, and position Bemlo as the obvious solution.
* Develop and refine strategies for faster, smoother onboarding of new customers.


**Who You Are**
* Educational or professional background in engineering.
* Solution-oriented with a passion for deeply understanding niche problems.
* Entrepreneurial mindset and ambition - ideally with dreams of starting your own company in the future.
* Excited by fast-paced startup environments where you help write the playbook, not just follow it.
* Collaborative by nature, with a passion for user-centered innovation.
* Fluent in Swedish.
* Holds a valid driver's license.
* Outgoing and service-minded.


**Location**
 We believe the best ideas come when we work together. This is a full-time role based in Stockholm. The position includes some travel to customers across Sweden for meetings and collaboration.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to drive the implementation of generative AI within the public sector and healthcare.
* Close collaboration with the company’s founders and leadership teams at our customer organizations — your work will matter from day one.
* Competitive salary and a transparent, generous stock option program.
* A chance to help shape a category-defining company.


 We’re just at the beginning of our journey to become the market-leading scheduling and workforce management platform. The deals are big, demand is high, and the opportunity to shape the use of generative AI in healthcare is wide open.

title: Portföljledare för verksamhetsutvecklingsprojekt
description:
OM TJÄNSTEN
   

  

 Arbetsgivare: Svenska kraftnät Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning, heltid
   

  

 Placeringsort: Sundbyberg, Stockholm
   

  

 Distansarbete: Upp till 50 % möjligt Sista ansökningsdag: 18 augusti 2025
   

  

 Kvalifikationer: Akademisk examen inom relevant område eller motsvarande kompetens. Flerårig erfarenhet av projekt- och portföljstyrning, vana vid att arbeta strategiskt mot ledningsgrupper och i tvärfunktionella miljöer. Du behärskar svenska och engelska mycket väl i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Meriterande: Erfarenhet av verksamhetsutvecklingsprojekt, IT-implementering nära verksamheten samt bakgrund från energibranschen.
   

  

 På division System får du arbeta med elsystemets mest spännande utmaningar – från drifttimmen här och nu till planeringen 40 år framåt. Den stora komplexiteten och utvecklingsmöjligheterna gör vårt arbete både stimulerande och betydelsefullt. Här får du ett unikt helhetsperspektiv på elsystemet och samarbetar nära kollegor för att säkerställa en trygg, hållbar och effektiv elförsörjning.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Som portföljledare inom division System får du en nyckelroll i att driva och samordna arbetet med vår projektportfölj – en av fyra delportföljer inom verksamheten. Du säkerställer att rätt projekt startas, genomförs och följs upp på ett effektivt och strategiskt sätt. Portföljens processer och styrverktyg har utvecklats de senaste åren och nu söker vi dig som både kan förvalta och vidareutveckla dem. Arbetet sker i nära samverkan med ledning, resursplanering och andra divisioner.
   

  

**Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter**
* Ta fram besluts- och rapporteringsunderlag till delportföljrådet genom att sammanställa information från pågående projekt/program samt leda möten med rådets ledningsgrupp.
* Säkerställa att portföljen är aktuell och korrekt genom att ansvara för kvalificerings-, rapporterings-och uppföljningsprocessen.
* Inför nya projekt driva och samordna beredningsarbetet, inklusive nyttobedömning, kontroll av genomförbarhet och att rätt förutsättningar finns på plats, samt ta fram förslag till prioritering för beslut i portföljrådet.
* Säkerställa att portföljens styrverktyg, såsom prioritetslista, långsiktig plan och beroendekartor är uppdaterade och kommuniceras till berörda i verksamheten.
* Stödja arbetet att identifiera nya projekt och initiativ för att nå Svenska kraftnäts strategiska mål.
* Delta i och driva utveckling av portföljstyrning samt verksamhetsutveckling inom enheten, avdelningen och mellan divisioner.


 Du kommer att tillhöra enheten Systemprojekt som idag består av tjugotre medarbetare och ett flertal konsulter. Det är en öppen och trevlig enhet med medarbetare i olika åldrar. Vi har en god stämning där vi hjälper och stöttar varandra. Enhetens ansvar innefattar projektledning, planering, uppföljning samt samordning av divisionens projektportfölj.
   

  

 Om dig
   

  

**Skallkrav**
 Som person är du strukturerad och planerar ditt arbete på ett effektivt och organiserat sätt. Du är trygg i osäkra situationer, vågar stå upp för dina åsikter med tydlighet och respekt, samt skiljer på sak och person. Det gör att du kommunicerar öppet och konstruktivt, vilket bygger förtroende och främjar goda samarbeten över organisatoriska gränser. Eftersom rollen bidrar till verksamhetens övergripande utveckling behöver du också vara analytisk och kunna navigera komplexa frågeställningar ur flera perspektiv, med fokus på långsiktiga mål.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare Har Du En Akademisk Examen Inom Ett För Tjänsten Relevant Område Eller Motsvarande Kunskap Förvärvad På Annat Sätt Som Svenska Kraftnät Bedömer Likvärdigt. Du Har Även
   

  

* Mångårig erfarenhet av att arbeta i en operativ, strategisk och förvaltande roll inom projekt- och/eller portföljstyrning.
* Vana av att agera på strategisk nivå och gentemot högre ledningsgrupper.
* Erfarenhet av att driva projekt- och utvecklingsarbete.
* Stor erfarenhet av tvärfunktionellt arbete, gärna i en större organisation.
* En mycket god förmåga att förstå och kunna uttrycka dig på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du har kunskap och erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Att arbeta i rollen som projektledare för verksamhetsutvecklingsprojekt.
* Att arbeta med implementering av verksamhetsnära IT.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet från energibranschen.


 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm/Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Resor kan förekomma i begränsad utsträckning
* Sista ansökningsdag 18 augusti 2025. Vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


 Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Elisabeth Larsson, tel. 010 475 84 75. Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Linda Mattsson. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Erica Midfjäll ST, 010 475 87 31. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

 Under sommartid är svarstiden något längre än vanligt pga. semestertider.

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. title: Transformation Roadmap Lead
job_function: Business Development, General Business, and Management
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Are you driven by clarity, structure, and strategic impact? Join Group Digitalisation as Transformation Roadmap Lead and drive the execution of Saab’s digital strategy. If you thrive on creating clarity, alignment and impact across complex initiatives, this role is for you.*
 Your role
   

  

 Your role will involve leading the establishment and ongoing management of the transformation roadmap, clearly articulating the key initiatives through which the group-wide digital strategy is primarily implemented. This will include identifying, defining, and setting up these initiatives to ensure the strategy can be executed with transparency and certainty across multiple dimensions, such as business, product, data, technology, and people.
   

  

 You will conduct continuous analysis and proactive problem-solving to ensure planned progress and agreed outcomes. Additionally, you will oversee and manage key dependencies, milestones, and risks effectively. You will implement mechanisms to manage stakeholders and communicate progress, results, and challenges broadly. Furthermore, you will continuously evaluate the roadmap and recommend corrective actions to ensure a robust strategy implementation.
   

  

 You will be part of a team dedicated to the continuous development of Saab's digital strategy, supporting its execution to ensure the necessary direction, pace, and coordination across various initiatives and teams.
   

  

 Location is flexible and can be decided upon agreement.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 We’re looking for someone with strong facilitation skills and the ability to engage confidently across leadership, engineering, product and commercial teams. You know how to build and maintain alignment across dispersed stakeholders, managing complexity without losing clarity or momentum. Your written and verbal communication is excellent, particularly in settings involving executive-level steering groups. With a structured, systems-oriented mindset and a pragmatic approach to prioritisation, you bring focus and direction where it’s most needed. You’re comfortable navigating ambiguity and skilled at leading through influence in a matrixed environment.
   

  

 Requirements:
   

  

* At least 10 years of experience, including a minimum of 5 years driving digital transformation, portfolio or program management, or leading a TMO/PMO function—either within a digitally mature industrial company with autonomous Business Areas, or as a consultant serving such organisations.
* Proven experience in building structured, cross-functional roadmaps across business, product, tech and people dimensions.
* Industry experience in engineered products and/or the defense sector is highly desirable.
* Strong ability to architect and align transformation roadmaps that tie into overarching company strategy to a software-enabled product portfolio.
* Skilled in defining clear phasing, dependencies, and success metrics, and in connecting high-level strategic ambitions to operational milestones.
* Adept at identifying capability gaps, prioritisation logic, and transformation governance models.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*

title: Senior Test Lead/Tester – GCP & ETL| SEB, Solna
description:
Do you want to be at the forefront of building transaction monitoring systems that leverage advanced algorithms to detect financial anomalies and combat economic crime? If you're ready to test complex problems with cutting-edge technology, we have the perfect opportunity for you!
   

  

 At SEB, we’re not just a bank—we’re a tech-driven organization leveraging AI, cloud technology, and machine learning to build solutions that safeguard our financial systems. Join us to help test next-gen solutions that protect financial institutions and help us fight financial crimes.
   

  

**About The Role**
 SEB AB is seeking a Senior Test Lead / Test Developer to join our Financial Crime Prevention department. You will play a critical role in ensuring the quality of data platforms and business logic that support our mission to detect and prevent financial crime. This includes testing cloud-native pipelines, rule engines, and end-to-end data workflows across the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
   

  

 This role goes beyond traditional testing. You'll guide teams, shape QA strategies, and collaborate closely with developers and requirement engineers to align testing with business goals and regulatory compliance. You will also take ownership of testing rule-based engines, which form the core of decision-making in financial crime detection systems.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities Include**
* Define and evolve Test Strategy, Test Plans, Test Environments, Integration Checklists, and Regression Test Suites
* Lead ETL and data validation testing in GCP using tools like BigQuery, Dataflow, and Pub/Sub
* Test rule-based engines and complex business logic used in financial crime detection
* Develop automated test cases using Python and Java (PyTest, JUnit, TestNG, etc.)
* Ensure quality across APIs, data transformations, and real-time streaming processes
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines
* Work closely with SW developers, Business Analyst, and architects in agile teams
* Guide testing best practices, mentor others, and support exploratory and compliance testing activities


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Minimum 8 - 10 years of experience in testing data-driven systems or enterprise QA roles
* Strong knowledge of Python, Java, and SQL for test development and data validation
* Hands-on experience with GCP and tools like BigQuery, Bigtable, and Composer
* Familiarity with ETL testing, data modeling, and data lineage validation
* Understanding of rule-based engines (e.g., decision tables, or similar)
* Strong system-thinking and ability to align QA with business and compliance requirements
* Excellent documentation and collaboration skills in agile environments
* B.Sc., M.Sc. or Ph.D. and experience from Complex software system
* It is meritorious if you have ISTQB (Foundation, Agile, or Automation level), Google Cloud Certification, REQB Certified Professional for Requirements Engineering


**What We Offer**
* Working at the forefront of Financial Crime Prevention in a mission-critical role
* Contributing to modernizing financial systems using GCP and cloud-native technologies
* Being part of a collaborative team focused on innovation, transparency, and impact
* Access continuous learning, development, and certification opportunities


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 25th of August 2025. If you believe you meet our criteria and you’re ready to make a real difference in the fight against financial crime, we’d love to meet with you!
   

  

 We will begin reviewing applications after week 33.
   

  

 For questions about the role, contact Shankar Gautam at +46 70 762 12 92.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: AI Engineer
description:
**About Filed**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating
 **fast-growing, sticky revenue** 
 , and are
 **backed by top-tier investors** 
 . We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say
 **“I was there when it all started.”**
 ⸻
   

  

**Here’s Why This Is a Terrible Job**
 This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
   

  

 We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
   

  

 If you need a few extra days to perfect your model, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
   

  

 We use tools like Cursor, OpenAI, and Gemini to prototype fast, test in prod, and push to users in hours—not quarters.
   

  

 You’ll be operating at the intersection of large language models, user behavior, regulatory compliance, and structured knowledge graphs.
   

  

 There are no clean datasets. No definitive papers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and noise from every direction.
   

  

 You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work?
   

  

 It is. And it’s not for everyone.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make**
 We’re hyperscaling. We’re very well-funded. Generating very fast revenue, and have reached a strong product market fit score all within 9 months.
   

  

 We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
   

  

 We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
   

  

 You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast.
   

  

 And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
   

  

 You’ll ship models because you believe in them, not because they passed a review board.
   

  

 You’ll talk to users weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
   

  

 We’ll tell you the goal. How you reach it—prompting, fine-tuning, embeddings, retrieval, structured data—is up to you.
   

  

 We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so precise it can predict what a user will ask, before they even ask it.
   

  

 That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**The Teammate We're Looking For**
* Thinks in probabilities, systems, and second-order consequences
* Navigates ambiguity across LLMs, APIs, and semi-structured corpora
* Gets excited by the edge cases most people run away from
* No research-for-research’s-sake — we ship fast and learn even faster
* Big bonus if you’ve shipped AI products into production, not just demos


 ⸻
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* Designing and implementing LLM-powered workflows across tax, finance, and compliance
* Building and scaling Graphiti-like knowledge systems for memory and retrieval
* Owning prompt pipelines, vector stores, fine-tuned models, and evals
* Becoming an Oracle with a model of the customer and the domain in your head


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Hard Skillset**
* Deep understanding of how LLMs actually work under the hood—beyond the hype
* Fluency with APIs like OpenAI, Gemini, Claude; experience with structured evals
* Comfortable working across Python and cloud infra (GCP or Azure)
* Strong grasp of embeddings, RAG, structured retrieval, and production-grade inference
* Bonus if you’ve contributed to or built internal tooling for model debugging or evals


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Soft Skillset**
* Ruthlessly pragmatic—knows when to ship and when to iterate
* Empathetic with users and critical of vague assumptions
* Deeply collaborative across product, engineering, and operations
* Obsessively curious—you want to understand everything about the domain you’re automating
* You own your outcomes—and love having your work in front of real users daily


 ⸻
   

  

**Growth And Levels**
 We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
   

  

 We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
   

  

 This isn’t a comfy AI role. It’s fast, focused, and brutally user-driven.
   

  

 You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**The process**
* Quick intro call
* Code and system walkthrough + async technical task
* Final round with our team
* Optional 2 to 3 day paid trial
* Then we decide together if this is the right fight


 ⸻
   

  

 If you want to work with real users, real constraints, and build AI that goes far beyond chatbot demos—this is it.
   

  

 Compensation Range: $71.5K - $149.5K

title: Head of Key Account Management
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience—fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index.
   

  

**Job Description**
 foodora Sweden is seeking a commercial leader to lead our Key Accounts Management team. If you are excited by an intense and rewarding journey to help grow one of the leading consumer brands in Sweden by 10x, and relate to everything that follows, we are looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Your mission**
 As Head of Key Accounts Management, you will play a central role in driving foodora’s growth by managing and developing relationships with our most important restaurant partners. You will:
   

  

**Lead our Key Accounts Management team**
* Be the caretaker of team morale and well being
* Raise the bar to drive improvements to performance and impact
* Identify personal development opportunities for team members and provide or secure the right form of mentorship / coaching / training


**Deliver on strategic goals around growth, business development and profitability for foodora and its partners by:**
* Shaping account-specific commercial strategies
* Leading negotiations and finding agreement between multiple internal and external stakeholders on win-win solutions
* Ensuring 360-degree execution of agreed plans


**Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key partners, and act as the main point of contact at foodora for our most valued accounts**
* Ensure effective and proactive contract management
* Monitor and analyze account performance, and identify areas for optimization by guiding analyses and translating data into insights
* Work cross-functionally and get in the detail to find practical solutions to complex problems, together with our teams across Commercial, Marketing, Operations and Finance


**Act as a liaison between foodora’s Swedish and Corporate organisations**
* Take ownership of implementing corporate driven initiatives and processes within Sweden
* Ensure successful local execution while providing timely and constructive feedback to the corporate team on any market-specific challenges or constraints that may impact compliance or effectiveness


**Qualifications**
* 6+ years of experience in client facing role(s) across commercial, account/partnerships management or business development functions
* Demonstrated experience in people leadership and senior stakeholder management
* A high degree of comfort working with operational and financial data, modeling out scenarios, and using intuition as well as data to make decisions
* Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken


 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**What’s in it for you?**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and insipring courses within Sana Labs.
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
**Schibsted Media strengthens democratic societies through independent, high-quality journalism.** 
 With leading media brands such as Aftonbladet, Svenska Dagbladet, Aftenposten and VG, we empower millions of people across the Nordics to make informed decisions every day.
   

  

 As we establish a new, dedicated IT organization for Schibsted, we are building modern, secure, and intuitive services to support our mission - and we need you on the journey.
   

  

 Are you passionate about building secure, high-performing networks in a hybrid cloud world? Do you thrive in complex environments where stability, speed, and innovation all matter at once? Then you might be the one we’re looking for.
   

  

**What you’ll do**
 As a
 **Senior Network Engineer** 
 , you’ll be at the heart of Schibsted’s network operations: designing, evolving, and safeguarding the infrastructure that powers our media brands across the Nordics. From cloud to on-prem, you’ll work with cutting-edge tools and enterprise-grade hardware to ensure our networks are fast, secure, and always on.
   

  

 You’ll lead incident responses, mentor engineers, and collaborate closely with security and platform teams. Whether you’re designing new architectures, troubleshooting critical issues, or driving network automation, your work keeps our systems resilient and our journalists connected.
   

  

 You’re someone who understands the importance of both technical depth and clear communication. You’re analytical, independent, and always looking ahead, anticipating problems and building smarter solutions.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities will be to:**
* Design and maintain scalable LAN/WAN architectures across hybrid environments
* Configure and support firewalls, routers, switches, wireless networks, and VPNs
* Monitor network health and security with modern tools and proactive analysis
* Lead incident responses, root cause analysis, and major troubleshooting efforts
* Collaborate with security teams to strengthen network defenses
* Support cloud networking integrations (AWS, Azure)
* Drive automation through scripting and infrastructure-as-code approaches
* Document network configurations, standards, and operational procedures
* Mentor junior engineers and provide technical guidance across teams
* Manage vendors and ensure smooth procurement and operations of network equipment


**What we’re looking for:**
 You’re a senior-level network expert with a track record of delivering robust solutions in complex environments. You balance deep technical expertise with a strategic mindset and thrive when solving both immediate issues and long-term challenges.
   

  

**We believe you bring:**
* 5+ years of experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining complex network infrastructures
* Relevant certifications, such as CCNA, CCNP, are preferred, though equivalent hands-on experience will also be considered
* Strong knowledge of TCP/IP, BGP, OSPF, VLANs, subnetting
* Proficiency in Cisco and Fortigate devices and enterprise networking gear
* Hands-on experience with VPNs, load balancing, and Zero Trust principles
* Familiarity with hybrid cloud networking (AWS, Azure) and SD-WAN
* Expertise in network monitoring tools (e.g. Wireshark)
* Scripting skills (Python, Bash, Ansible) for automation and efficiency
* A structured, analytical, and independent working style
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills across diverse teams


**What we offer**
 At Schibsted, you'll be part of a skilled and motivated infrastructure team working to support some of the most trusted media brands in the Nordics. You’ll contribute to meaningful technology that empowers journalism and serves the public good.
   

  

 We offer a modern tech environment, flexible work arrangements, generous benefits including pension and wellness support, and a strong focus on learning and development. You’ll work in an open, inclusive culture where ownership and initiative are encouraged – and where your work truly matters.
   

  

**Why join Schibsted?**
 At Schibsted, we value openness, curiosity, and collaboration. We empower our people to take ownership, think boldly, and drive meaningful change. You’ll join a diverse, inclusive environment where your work has a real impact on your colleagues, on our company, and on society.
   

  

* Help journalists focus on what they do best - telling the stories that matter.
* Apply today and be part of the future of media IT.

title: Product Engineer
description:
**TL;DR**
 We need exceptional senior full-stack engineers to help build the future of AI software engineering. You'll work across our entire stack to build features that tomorrow’s product builders need. Must be able to ship fast and tackle any technical challenge that comes your way.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
* Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* Work, learn, have fun: We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* Build a unique network: Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* Get autonomy & ownership: With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* Compensation: Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis


**What We're Looking For**
* You're a full-stack technical Swiss Army knife with 5+ years of experience
* You ship fast and break through walls instead of waiting for doors
* You're familiar with a variety of programming languages and understand fundamental principles behind scalable applications, tech stack, and databases
* You're comfortable not knowing everything but figuring it out anyway
* You have strong opinions about code quality but know when to move fast


**Your Responsibilities**
* In one sentence: Do whatever it takes to build a generational product
* Jump between frontend, backend, and infrastructure to build core functionality
* Define, design, and ship new features and participate in full dev lifecycle from planning and design to deployment and maintenance


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* And always exploring what's next


**How Applying Works**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call
* Complete a technical take-home exercise
* Dive deeper into your way of thinking during two technical interviews
* Join us for 1-2 days of trial work on-site if possible. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you are interested please apply through our application system.

title: Change Lead
job_function: Business Development, General Business, and Management
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Do you want to help shape Saab’s journey to differentiate its product portfolio through software and AI? Our new Group Digitalisation function is working across all business areas to drive this strategic transformation. We are now looking for a Change Lead to join the Digital Strategy & Acceleration team within Group Digitalisation. Ready to get involved? We need the best talent to help keep people and societies safe in an increasingly digital world.*
 Your role
   

  

 You will be part of a team dedicated to the continuous development of Saab’s digital strategy, ensuring its successful execution across multiple initiatives and teams. Your focus will be to lead the behavioural and mindset shift required to enable lasting, people-centred transformation.
   

  

 This is not a traditional change communication role. Instead, you will apply behavioural science, data and structured methods to identify which behaviours drive value and which hold us back—then design interventions that help shift those behaviours at scale. You will help define how leaders and teams across Saab think, act and adapt in a rapidly evolving environment.
   

  

 You will translate behavioural insights into targeted initiatives, working with cross-functional stakeholders to reshape the context around people: their incentives, capabilities, expectations and communication. You will ensure that the behavioural element of our transformation journey is not only well understood, but also measurable and aligned with Saab’s long-term business goals.
   

  

 Key responsibilities:
   

  

* Diagnose behavioural and cultural barriers to change, using both qualitative insights and quantitative data.
* Define and lead end-to-end behavioural change initiatives that support Saab’s transformation agenda.
* Develop and refine feedback loops to track progress and evolve strategies based on real outcomes.
* Identify and anchor key mindset shifts needed across leadership and teams, in collaboration with internal stakeholders.
* Contribute to a clear and consistent Change Narrative, aligned with Communications but grounded in behavioural science.
* Leverage modern tools, interactive formats and digital platforms to foster learning, dialogue and engagement.


 Location is flexible and can be decided upon agreement.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 We are looking for someone with a deep understanding of how lasting change happens in complex organisations. You combine academic grounding in behavioural science or organisational psychology with hands-on experience of leading transformation initiatives that deliver measurable impact.
   

  

 You are comfortable working conceptually and analytically, but just as willing to test, adapt and learn as you go. You use logic and data to build trust, and empathy and storytelling to create momentum. With a structured mindset and a pragmatic approach, you help teams and leaders shift behaviour in ways that create long-term value.
   

  

 Requirements:
   

  

* Ten years professional experience, of which at least five years have involved a strong focus on behavioural change, organisational transformation or leadership development.
* A university degree in behavioural science, psychology, organisational development or a related field.
* Proven experience in driving large-scale change initiatives that shift mindset and behaviour across functions and levels.
* Strong analytical skills and a structured, data-informed approach to planning, evaluating and adjusting change efforts.
* Experience from a digitally mature, decentralised organisation—or from a management consultancy supporting such organisations.
* Confident in navigating complex stakeholder landscapes and adapting communication to different audiences.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*
