title: AI Product Lead, LearnWith.AI (Remote) - $200,000/year USD
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Are you ready to revolutionize education with AI? Want to work on something actually important, which helps real students unlock their potential and learn faster, better, and happier? At LearnWith.AI, we're building the future of personalized learning, and we need product minds who don't just think fast, but learn fast.
   

  

 This role isn't about managing a product. It's about making specific, measurable outcomes happen every week. You'll get one clear goal tied to real student impact. Your job is to make that outcome true, then prove it with data. You'll go deep into the learning problem space, codify your thinking into structured "Brain Lifts" that make both humans and AI smarter, and drive tight, weekly product iterations until the result is undeniable. You'll be shipping meaningful features fast and refining them just as quickly.
   

  

 At LearnWith.AI, we're not layering technology onto a broken system. We're building a new one. The U.S. education model is outdated, designed for the average student in a one-size-fits-all classroom. Our platform combines 50+ years of learning science with subject matter experts and AI-powered coaching to deliver individualized instruction at scale. Whether it's helping a student bounce back from learning loss or crush their AP exams, we're proving that education can be both personal and high-impact.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Build Brain Lifts: Create structured, evolving frameworks of expert insights that sharpen AI tools, guide decisions, and demonstrate domain mastery.
* Drive Product Iterations: Ship data-driven product enhancements weekly that measurably advance student outcomes and learning effectiveness.
* Develop Domain Expertise: Master the learning science and educational landscape to empower the team with authoritative knowledge for high-quality decisions and tailored solutions.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Managing traditional product roadmaps or dictating what to build without clear outcome metrics
* Executing lengthy development cycles; our success depends on weekly feature shipping and rapid iteration
* Creating exhaustive documentation, managing backlogs, or defining every UI element and edge case
* Engineering technical solutions or determining software architecture


**AI Product Lead Key Responsibilities**
 Transform how students learn by delivering measurable improvements to educational outcomes through rapid, data-driven product iterations that combine learning science with AI-powered personalization.
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* Minimum 4 years of product leadership experience with direct responsibility for product vision and core problem-solution hypotheses
* Proven track record launching at least one successful product (not just features) from inception to user adoption
* Demonstrated enthusiasm and proficiency using AI tools in your daily work (research, analysis, synthesis, strategy)


**About LearnWith.AI**
 LearnWith.AI is an edtech startup that leverages AI and subject matter experts to cultivate a new way of learning. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and AI-powered coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn more, learn faster, and learn better - and have fun while doing it. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with us**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover as a Contractor of Record. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5599-SE-Stockhol-AIProductLead.003

title: Cloud Account Executive - Tableau Sweden
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

 Are you a sales professional with a passion for selling complex software solutions?
   

  

 At Tableau, a Salesforce company, we help people see, understand and action on their data.
   

  

 We have just released the first Agentic Analytics platform in the market: Tableau Next.We're looking for an Account Executive in Sweden to help Enterprise business organizations unlock the full potential of data-driven decision-making with Tableau Next's unique Agentic capabilities.
   

  

**About Us**
 Tableau’s mission is to make data accessible and actionable for everyone. As part of Salesforce, we combine cutting-edge technology with a commitment to customer success, creating real impact for businesses and communities alike. Our inclusive culture celebrates diverse perspectives and encourages innovation at every level.
   

  

**Your Role**
* Develop and Execute Sales Plans: Identify opportunities to expand within existing accounts and target new prospects.
* Build Relationships: Engage with key stakeholders, including C-level executives, to understand their needs and demonstrate the value of Tableau.
* Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with internal resources and Salesforce counterparts to align efforts and deliver exceptional customer outcomes.
* Drive Sales Cycles: Manage complex deals from prospecting to close, ensuring a strong pipeline and accurate forecasting.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience: 5+ years in software or technology sales, with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding quotas.
* Market Knowledge: Familiarity with SaaS solutions and the ability to navigate complex sales environments.
* Strong Communicator: Ability to engage at all organizational levels and clearly convey the benefits of our platform.
* Team Player: Comfortable working in a collaborative, matrixed environment to achieve common goals.
* Language Skills: Fluent in Swedish and English.


**Preferred Experience**
* Background in selling analytics, data, or business intelligence solutions.
* Experience in cloud or SaaS sales is a plus.
* Being passioned about Data, AI and Analytics / Tableau.


**Why Join Tableau?**
* Competitive Compensation: Uncapped commission potential with excellent benefits.
* Growth Opportunities: Access to the global Salesforce ecosystem for career development.
* Inclusive Environment: Be part of a culture that values diversity and fosters personal and professional growth.
* Impactful Work: Help businesses harness the power of data to make better decisions


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Senior Consultant (f/m/d) People & Organization Strategic Projects
description:
Our ambition as People and Organization (P&O) function is to co-own the overall Siemens transformation, enabling Siemens’ businesses to remain successful in an ever faster changing environment. Accordingly, our global P&O leadership team has recently set our new P&O Strategy 2030 and is reviewing P&O’s strategic priorities regularly. In this context, we are further expanding our recently established Strategic Projects team to contribute to the end-to-end deployment of the strategy and provide our businesses with the capabilities and capacities needed.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Engage in high-visibility projects in an international environment providing you with the chance to broaden your network across Siemens
* Contribute to the design of our brand-new unit and make your unique mark
* Be an integral part of Siemens’ transformation journey, directly creating impact and accompanying implementation
* Be a member of a new highly diverse team intended to incubate people for Siemens with broad personal growth perspectives by living your passion for people & organization
* 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard


 Since each of over 300,000 team members feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information here.
   

  

 The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, local or corporate conditions.
   

  

**What role will you play:**
 As a Senior Consultant (f/m/d) for Strategic P&O Projects, you will play a crucial role in driving P&O's key strategic priorities alongside responsible P&O professionals and business colleagues.
   

  

 In particular, you will…
   

  

* set-up, structure, and steer multiple modules in the execution of complex and high-visibility P&O projects on an international scale. This will give you the opportunity to quickly expand your network across Siemens
* jointly with the accountable P&O experts and the businesses shape the P&O solution landscape and drive the deployment of our P&O Strategy 2030
* join forces with our global P&O business partners and P&O country heads to implement strategic projects generating impact and drive positive change
* be a change agent, think end-to-end, challenge, hypothesize, test & build innovative solutions ensuring effective implementation from the start
* orchestrate the ecosystem of key stakeholders incl. business, P&O, and contributors/ service providers
* connect the dots and enable your colleagues to identify and address interdependencies with other ongoing strategic P&O efforts
* leverage data to design all efforts for maximum user impact, striving to make valuable contributions to Siemens holistically
* offer a fresh perspective by introducing new ways of working and are open to experiment, e.g., agile-inspired approaches
* contribute to shaping our team, managed in Squads and Chapters, within the Siemens P&O function


**What we expect:**
* Experience & Skills
+ You have an excellent academic background (Master’s Degree or equivalent experience)
+ You bring extensive professional experience in management-/ strategy-/ transformation consulting – with a focus on P&O / HR topics and preferably in Siemens-related industries
+ You possess outstanding analytical, communication and stakeholder management skills. You demonstrate the dynamics of a large organization and use smart influencing to effectuate change
+ In addition, you have a sound and broad P&O / HR domain know-how, e.g. acquired in a HR Business Partner or HR CoE / Expert role (i.e., learning, talent management, organizational excellence, mergers & acquisitions, skill management, HR tool landscape / digitalization, change concepts) – we know, nobody has it all :-)
+ You ideally also bring eperience with AI use cases in the context of P&O projects

* Ways of working
+ You are a fast learner, eager to understand in depth and apply the relevant concepts and tools, and committed to comprehensive optimization
+ You have an entrepreneurial “can do” attitude and are excited to shape this team

* Languages
+ Proficiency in English


 You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you!
   

  

 Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Let’s get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities. In the case of equal qualifications, severely disabled applicants and applicants with equivalent status will be given preference.
   

  

**About Us**
 We know that our business thrives only when our people thrive and unlock their full potential. That’s why you are always our top priority. Our global, diverse team is ready to support, challenge, and inspire you, helping you grow in countless ways. Together, we’ll embark on an exciting journey of discovery. Who knows where this path will lead? Join us and take an active role in shaping your future!

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
DLL is seeking a strategic and results-driven Senior Account Manager to join our LifeTech team in Sweden. LifeTech covers the Workplace, Technology, and Healthcare sectors. You will be supporting growth across these sectors. We offer B2B financing solutions that enable our partners to deliver complete, value-added packages to their professional customers.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for managing and expanding relationships with key partners, supporting them in offering financing for a wide range of equipment, from laptops and copiers to CT scanners and entire data centres. You will drive both account development and new business acquisition, with a strong focus on structuring complex, high-value deals that require customized solutions and cross-functional collaboration.
   

  

 Success in this role demands a consultative approach, commercial acumen, and the ability to navigate intricate deal structures through DLL’s internal approval processes. You’ll work closely with departments such as credit, legal and risk to ensure alignment and timely execution, while maintaining a high standard of service for our partners.
   

  

 Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL
   

  

 Day to day
   

  

* Develop and strengthen relationships with local suppliers and global vendors in the LifeTech market
* Identify and formalize new partnerships through strategic agreements
* Structure and negotiate tailored financing solutions, including non-standard transactions
* Lead internal alignment across credit, legal, and risk teams to secure approvals for complex deals
* Create and maintain account plans, forecasts, and pipeline management
* Train partner sales teams on financing tools and value propositions
* Support partner-led customer meetings to secure financing agreements
* Build and maintain a strong internal network to support business objectives and respond to external developments


**All members enjoy**
* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Check this link to an overview of all benefits in your region.


 “We not only live up to the expectations of our customers for today, but also anticipate their market needs of tomorrow.”
   

  

 Essentials
   

  

 You are a commercially driven professional with a consultative mindset and a proven ability to manage complex B2B sales processes. You thrive in environments that require strategic thinking, stakeholder management, and solution-based selling.
   

  

* Demonstrated experience in managing complex sales involving multiple internal stakeholders
* Strong financial acumen, including the ability to interpret financial statements and assess risk
* Skilled in contract negotiation and structuring bespoke solutions
* Background in financial services, leasing, insurance, software, or IT equipment is preferred
* University degree (Bachelor’s or higher)
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken


 This position is based in Stockholm, with close collaboration across DLL’s commercial and support teams. If you’re ready to make an impact in a fast-paced, tech-driven environment, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 Choose wellbeing
   

  

 DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.
   

  

**Our Four Wellbeing Categories Are As Follows**
* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


 These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL
   

  

 Settling in
   

  

 At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.
   

  

 But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.
   

  

 Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and a honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.
   

  

 Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.
   

  

 We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind:
 **Partnering for a better world**
 Good to know
   

  

* Deadline for application: August 17th (application deadline may close sooner if a high number of applications are received)
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #IND123
* For more information or additional questions, you are welcome to contact our Talent Acquisition Partner Joep Staps via joep.staps@dllgroup.com


 DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.
   

  

 DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: Tax Technology Specialist
description:
*Do you want to help shape the future of tax advisory? KPMG offers a unique opportunity to take a leading role in the growth of their tax transformation business. You'll work closely with Nordic and global networks in a flexible culture. Together, we make a real impact – for our clients, the industry, and your career.*
**The Role**
 KPMG Sweden is seeking an experienced and dynamic Tax Technology Specialist to join the Tax Transformation team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in tax technology and data management to support clients in developing and implementing innovative tax solutions. You will play a critical role in building out our practice to support our client in shaping their tax data strategy, creating tax technology roadmaps, and guiding them through vendor selections. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of building out our practice, driving business development, and enhancing the value of our services.
   

  

**Your responsibilities will include:**
* Lead KPMG Sweden’s Tax Technology and Tax Data Management practice including developing and implementing innovative data-driven strategies to address client challenges and opportunities.
* Collaborate with clients to develop a comprehensive tax data strategy that aligns with their overall business objectives. This involves understanding their unique tax data landscape and challenges. Analyse their tax data maturity, identify gaps, and define data needs that align with their business objectives.
* Collaborate with clients to develop a tailored roadmap for optimizing their tax data management. This might involve recommending and implementing new technologies, data cleansing procedures, and automation tools.
* Collaborate with both client tax and finance departments to integrate tax technology solutions that enhance compliance processes and unlock valuable insights from their data.
* Partner with compliance and process specialists to identify opportunities for automating manual tasks and streamlining client tax and finance workflows and processes.
* Leverage your tax and technology expertise to identify new client opportunities for Tax Transformation services by leveraging existing client relationships, identifying new opportunities and effectively communicating the value of our tax transformation services.
* Build a collaborative and inclusive team environment that promotes continuous learning, knowledge sharing, and innovative thinking within the Tax Technology practice.


 The role is based in the office on Vasagatan in Stockholm, for the right person placement in another location is possible.
   

  

 At KPMG, you become part of a corporate culture where the individual is important. KPMG offers great development opportunities in a diverse environment where you will be challenged through exciting and socially important involvement with clients. You are offered a varied and responsible role where the pace is often high, with many opportunities for stimulating social contacts, constant change and knowledge development. KPMG offers a comprehensive internal training and development program with the opportunity to develop within your areas of interest.
   

  

 ,
   

  

 We are seeking a professional with a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology, Accounting, Finance, Taxation, or a related field. Professional certifications such as CPA, CA, or an equivalent designation are highly preferred. The ideal candidate will have more than five years of hands-on experience in tax technology, data management, or a related role, preferably gained within leading consulting firms—such as the Big Four—or multinational corporations. A proven track record in leading and implementing tax technology or data management solutions is considered a strong advantage.
   

  

 A solid understanding of tax data management and compliance processes, along with familiarity with tax technology platforms, is essential. This includes experience with data analytics tools, data lakes, data warehouses, and data engineering platforms such as Databricks, as well as tax provision and compliance software. The candidate should demonstrate excellent analytical skills and possess a deep understanding of financial data, accounting systems, and financial operations.
   

  

 We value individuals who are passionate about driving digital transformation in finance and tax, and who bring a forward-thinking mindset with a willingness to challenge established processes in order to foster innovation. Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills are critical for success in this role. Moreover, the ability to identify and act upon new business opportunities, build and maintain client relationships, and collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams is essential.
   

  

**Do you want to know more?**
 In this process KPMG is working with Level Recruitment. To apply, please click the apply button. If you have further questions don´t hesitate to contact recruitment consultant Dennis Pater at +46 735 58 89 34 or Christian Smith at +46 8-120 50 410. Please note that we need your application written in English. We will interview ongoingly so please register your application as soon as possible.

title: Retail & Wholesale Internship
description:
**We're opening our very first physical store this fall and it's a big moment for Understatement!** 




  





 To support this exciting new chapter and strengthen our growing wholesale business, we're now looking for our next Retail & Wholesale Intern to join our team for at least 3-4 months.
 



  





 In this role, you'll work closely with our commercial and retail teams and gain hands-on experience in how to launch, operate, and grow a retail space and wholesale business from the inside out. You'll play an active part in planning, operations, merchandising, and B2B relationships with the opportunity to truly shape what our store and wholesale channels can become.
 



  





 If you're the person we're looking for, you're probably a student in business, retail management, or fashion studies, with a strong interest in commercial strategy and brand experience.
 



  





 To thrive with us, you should be structured, hands-on, curious, and excited to work in a fast-paced and creative environment. You love being involved in a variety of tasks - from logistics and planning to showroom styling or working with retailers - and you're eager to bring your own ideas to the table.
 



  





  





**What you'll get to do:** 




  




* Support the setup and launch of our first flagship store
* Assist in retail planning, VM, inventory, POS operations and store experience
* Work with our wholesale team on showroom appointments, order handling and B2B outreach
* Help coordinate with retailers and agents, and contribute to sales support
* Support the retail & wholesale calendar with campaign, delivery and product updates



  





  





**Qualifications:** 




  





 We think you have:
 


* Studies or background in business, fashion, retail or related fields
* Strong organizational and time-management skills: you take ownership and get things done
* High attention to detail and an interest in both the operational and creative sides of retail
* A proactive and driven mindset - you love learning and trying new things
* Excellent communication skills and fluency in English (Swedish or German is a plus!)
* Experience with project management tools is a bonus



  





 The internship takes place at our office and showroom in Södermalm, Stockholm. The scope and schedule of the internship can be discussed, but we prefer a minimum of 3 months. The internship is unpaid and can be combined with part-time work or studies.
 



  





 Applications are reviewed continuously.

title: Senior Guidewire Tech Lead - PC, BC, Integration (relocation to Sweden)
description:
**Hello, let’s meet!** 




 We are Xebia – a place where experts grow. For nearly two decades now, we’ve been developing digital solutions for clients from many industries and places across the globe. Among the brands we’ve worked with are UPS, McLaren, Aviva, Deloitte, and many, many more.
 



 We’re passionate about Cloud-based solutions. So much so, that we have a partnership with three of the largest Cloud providers in the business – Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP). We even became the first AWS Premier Consulting Partner in Poland.
 



 Formerly we were known as PGS Software. In 2021, we joined Xebia Group – a family of interlinked companies driven by the desire to make a difference in the world of technology.
 



 Xebia stands for innovation, talented team members, and technological excellence. Xebia means worldwide recognition, and thought leadership. This regularly provides us with the opportunity to work on global, innovative projects.
 



 Our mission can be captured in one word: Authority. We want to be recognized as the authority in our field of expertise.
 



 What makes us stand out? It’s the little details, like our attitude, dedication to knowledge, and the belief in people’s potential – emphasizing every team members development. Obviously, these things are not easy to present on paper – so, make sure to visit us to see it with your own eyes!
 



**Now, we’ve talked a lot about ourselves – but we’d love to hear more about you.** 




**Send us your resume to start the conversation and join Xebia!** 




  





**You will be:** 



* leading and mentoring a team of Guidewire developers working on PolicyCenter (PC) and BillingCenter (BC),
* collaborating closely with stakeholders and clients to define solution architecture and technical direction,
* hands‑on with Guidewire development, configuration, integration, and customization,
* responsible for overseeing CI/CD pipelines, DevOps processes, and deployment strategies for Guidewire applications,
* driving architectural decisions, balancing configuration vs customization trade‑offs.



  





**Your profile:** 



* willingness to
 **relocate to Sweden**
 and
 **join the client on‑site after 6 months,**
* 5+ years of hands‑on experience with Guidewire PolicyCenter and BillingCenter,
* deep knowledge of Guidewire Integration Framework (GOSU, Web Services, Messaging),
* 3+ years working in GOSU,
* proven track record leading Guidewire implementations or upgrades,
* strong expertise in ACE (Advanced Configuration Engineering),
* practical understanding of configuration vs customization trade‑offs,
* experience with DevOps and CI/CD tools tailored for Guidewire,
* demonstrated leadership in agile delivery teams,
* English proficiency at B2–C1 level.



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Guidewire certification in PC and/or BC,
* experience with ClaimCenter,
* familiarity with data migration and archival strategies in Guidewire,
* practical experience in Java development.



  





**Recruitment Process** 




**CV** 
 review –
 **HR** 
 call –
 **Interview** 
 –
 **Client** 
 Interview –
 **Decision**

title: Group Safety and Health Manager
description:
Global Safety and Health Manager Position
   

  

 Do you want to help us accelerate the transformation in the mining and construction industry? Demand for critical metals and minerals will sharply increase as we transition to a climate-neutral society. Our role is to help extract these minerals and metals in the most sustainable way possible. Now, we're seeking a highly motivated Global Safety and Health Manager
   

  

 Are you someone who is analytic, has strong project management skills and thinks safety and health is key? It all starts with people like you.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As a key member of our Sustainability and SHEQ team, you'll play a vital role as we strive to eliminate work-related injuries and reach our 2030 goal of no work-related injuries. As a Safety and Health Manager, you will further develop and improve the safety culture in Epiroc, drive meaningful changes, support and guide the organization and strengthen our competitive position and meet customer demands.
   

  

 You will lead collaboration activities with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders and provide support to various groups.
   

  

 You will work closely with colleagues both at Group level but also with divisions and local level. You will report to VP Sustainability.
   

  

 Your responsibilities and tasks will include, but are not limited to:
   

  

* Drive and implement global strategic and operational safety and health improvements in collaboration with divisions and local level.
* Promote, support and guide the organization on safety and health issues.
* Share best practices and deploy prevention tools.
* Develop and communicate Group guidelines and requirements.
* Lead internal safety projects.
* Follow up health and safety performance as well as highlight areas where we need to improve.
* Application owner of common OHS applications and processes.
* Develop internal training.
* Collection, consolidation, and analysis of ESG data for reporting and internal decision-making.
* Drive continuous improvement.
* Monitor new reporting requirements and develop processes to utilize sustainability data to advance our agenda.
* Perform internal audits on entities and on divisions.
* Work with other sustainability topics.


 In this role you will not have any direct reporting staff, but you will ensure success through collaboration with the divisions and the entities in the Group.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To succeed as our Global Safety and Health Manager, you should have:
   

  

* A Bachelor or a Master Degree of science, sustainability, industrial engineering, behavioral science or similar.
* Several years of relevant work experience, preferably from an operational environment, from multinational companies or similar.
* Familiarity with laws, regulations and standards in the OHS area.
* Strong analytical skills to gather, analyze and make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent project management skills.
* Great skills in MS Office (especially in Excel) and Power BI.
* Bilingual in Swedish & English with strong verbal & written communication skills in both languages.
* A keen interest in health and safety and an understanding of the complexity in a decentralized multi-national organization under various legislations and regulations.


 If you're a curious, enthusiastic, and pragmatic individual with a results-oriented mindset, along with a passion for health and safety and sustainability, combined with the determination to drive change, we extend a warm invitation for you to join our team.
   

  

 We believe you are a true networker that can naturally build relationships and influence across functions and divisions to adopt best practices and continuous improvement.
   

  

 Together, let's embark on a journey to create excellence and shape the future of the mining and construction industry.
   

  

**Location and travel**
 This position is preferably in Stockholm or Örebro, Sweden. Occasional travel is required. Both domestic and international, mainly to our entities, but also to customers and to other relevant events.
   

  

**Life at Epiroc**
 By joining our team, you can expect an atmosphere of creativity, innovation, and workplace diversity. You will be a part of a group of skilled and helpful colleagues who live by our core values: Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. We work in a global environment with over 113 different nationalities!
   

  

 In addition to the fact that we have a culture that is characterized by development combined with having a good balance between work and leisure, there are some things that make us a little extra proud to work at Epiroc:
   

  

* Global career opportunities
* Epiroc University, for your own competence development
* Community involvement
* Benefits package, which amongst other things include flexible working hours and a bonus.


**A hybrid workplace**
 Life in Epiroc can include the possibility of a hybrid workplace. It is a way of working that offers flexibility and participation, allowing for a better balance between work and private life, which also promotes well-being. The hybrid workplace is an opportunity if work allows, based on your role, responsibilities, and individual conditions.
   

  

**Application and contact information**
 You are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible by creating an account in our recruitment system. In this recruitment process, we review applications continuously. The last day to apply for this position is
 **August 21st, 2025.**
 For questions about the position please contact Nina Fazeli, Recruitment Specialist, at nina.fazeli@external.epiroc.com
   

  

*Please note that due to regulations, we cannot handle applications received through email.*
*We have already made our choices regarding advertising channels and consulting providers, and kindly request not to be contacted regarding such inquiries.*
**Epiroc** 
 is a global productivity partner for mining and construction customers, and accelerates the transformation toward a sustainable society. With ground-breaking technology, Epiroc develops and provides innovative and safe equipment, such as drill rigs, rock excavation and construction equipment and tools for surface and underground applications. The company also offers world-class service and other aftermarket support as well as solutions for automation, digitalization and electrification. Epiroc is based in Stockholm, Sweden, had revenues of more than SEK 60 billion in 2023, and has around 18 200 passionate employees supporting and collaborating with customers in around 150 countries. Learn more at www.epiroc.com.

title: Global SEM and Programmatic Manager
description:
**Grow with us**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you a digital media expert ready to take SEM and programmatic strategies to the next level? Ericsson is looking for a Director of SEM & Programmatic to lead our paid media initiatives, ensuring cutting-edge, AI-powered, data-driven, and impactful activations across global digital channels. As Director of SEM & Programmatic, you’ll be driving digital media innovation and leveraging AI to maximize media performance. You’ll work in a dynamic, forward-thinking environment where strategy, creativity, and technology come together.
   

  

 This role is part of the Paid & Social Media team within Group Function Marketing, reporting to the Global Head of Paid & social media. You will play a crucial role in optimizing media investments, driving efficiency, and maximizing business growth through smart, performance-led strategies.
   

  

***If you're passionate about creativity and eager to contribute to global projects, we want you on our team!***
**What You Will Do**
**Global SEM & Programmatic Strategy**
* Lead the development of Ericsson’s global SEM and programmatic roadmap, aligning with business objectives, brand direction, and digital media goals.
* Own and evolve the in-house SEM capability—establishing processes, governance, toolsets, and team structures to drive operational excellence.
* Identify innovation opportunities across AI, automation, and audience targeting to elevate performance and efficiency across digital platforms.
* Champion Ericsson’s approach to intelligent media investments—blending data, tech, and creativity to deliver results.


**Campaign Planning, Activation & Execution**
* Manage the end-to-end planning, execution, and optimization of global SEM and programmatic campaigns across markets and business areas.
* Ensure smart audience strategies, keyword frameworks, and budget allocations across paid search, display, video, and emerging inventory.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—to integrate media efforts with business and campaign priorities.
* Work with platform partners (Google, Microsoft, DSPs) and internal teams to ensure best-in-class execution and agile campaign management.


**Performance, Measurement & Growth**
* Define KPIs and success metrics to evaluate media performance and business impact.
* Partner with the Marketing Analytics & Automation team to implement testing frameworks, derive insights, and enable real-time optimization.
* Develop dashboards, reporting cadence, and knowledge-sharing structures to scale learning and performance globally.
* Track industry trends and platform updates—ensuring Ericsson stays ahead of the curve in a fast-moving digital environment.


**Collaboration & Leadership**
* Partner with regional and cross-functional teams to establish a unified, high-performing SEM and programmatic approach across global markets.
* Serve as the organization’s go-to expert for in-house paid search and programmatic, providing leadership on strategy, tooling, and performance excellence.
* Lead with a builder’s mindset—fostering a collaborative culture of experimentation, learning, and innovation throughout the in-housing journey.
* Inspire and align internal stakeholders around digital media’s role in business growth—translating complexity into clear direction.
* Build capability by mentoring teams and equipping them with frameworks, best practices, and training to elevate in-house digital maturity.


**Skills You Bring**
* 8+ years of hands-on experience driving SEM and programmatic strategies—ideally in global B2B, enterprise, or tech-led environments.
* Deep knowledge of Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, demand-side platforms (DSPs), and in-housing models—including tooling, operations, and measurement.
* Strong analytical acumen with demonstrated use of automation, AI, and data insights to inform and optimize digital media performance.
* Proven track record managing high-impact media investments and vendor relationships, with a focus on efficiency and effectiveness.
* Skilled communicator and influencer—able to lead across functions, cultures, and seniority levels.
* A strategic thinker and proactive doer—capable of shaping long-term direction while navigating day-to-day execution.


***This is a full-time position with hybrid work, based in Stockholm, Kista, starting as soon as possible. Ready to lead SEM & programmatic strategy at a global level? Apply now and be part of the future at Ericsson!***
**We will removing applications ongoing, however interviews will be booked in early August. Last applying date is 1st of aug.**
**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 769374

title: Senior Solutions Engineer
description:
**About NetApp**
 NetApp is the intelligent data infrastructure company, turning a world of disruption into opportunity for every customer. No matter the data type, workload or environment, we help our customers identify and realize new business possibilities. And it all starts with our people.
   

  

 If this sounds like something you want to be part of, NetApp is the place for you. You can help bring new ideas to life, approaching each challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, you won't be doing it alone. At NetApp, we're all about asking for help when we need it, collaborating with others, and partnering across the organization - and beyond.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 As a Senior Solutions Engineer, you determine customer needs for solutions and services from NetApp. You analyze customer requirements and convert them into technical solution concepts. You can present NetApp technologies to customers at different levels of responsibility, adapt to the interlocutors and question their motives and motivational factors. You not only support sales in the first technical customer discussions but are also responsible for the technical elaboration of the solutions offered.
   

  

 Your area of responsibility
   

  

 Your area of responsibility includes the technical representation of NetApp and in particular the analysis of existing cloud, IT, network, application, backup and storage landscapes at customers. In the role of a Trusted Advisor, you are responsible for developing solution concepts and architectures, which you will present to a larger audience as part of a technical customer presentation. Active contact with customers in cooperation with the responsible Client Executive and ensuring that technically complex inquiries are handled competently and implemented professionally are the focus of this task.
   

  

 Your Profile
   

  

 Are you enthusiastic about innovative technology and would you like to constantly develop yourself?
   

  

 Do you find it easy to explain complex issues and do you find yourself in the following points?
   

  

* Interest in current trends in IT and technologies used (e.g. public clouds, hybrid clouds, container technologies, DevOps concepts, artificial intelligence)
* High motivation to actively advise our customers on their path to digital transformation and to develop joint solutions
* You can think analytically, are creative and team-oriented
* You like to bring different people together and work towards a common goal
* IT knowledge, including in enterprise/cloud computing, virtualization, storage, backup or high availability solutions
* Knowledge of storage technologies is desirable
* Successfully completed technical training or technical studies with appropriate professional experience
* Very good knowledge of Swedish and English Language


 At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.
   

  

 At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, and any protected classification.
   

  

**Why NetApp?**
 In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world's biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.
   

  

 We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favourite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.
   

  

 If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.

title: Medical Science Expert, Endo & Fertility
description:
Work Your Magic with us!
   

  

 Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you’ve got big plans – so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people’s lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.
   

  

 United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.
   

  

**Your Role**
 Are you ready to kick off the next step of your career and take an active part in the future of our journey at our team in Sweden? We are looking for a skilled colleague with previous experience in fertility to strengthen our Medical Affairs team in Sweden.
   

  

 Main purpose of the job is
   

  

 To drive collaborations and medical educations together with key stakeholders in the field of fertility and to build scientific relationships.
   

  

 To provide medical expertise and education and actively partner with the cross functional brand team members in addition to driving the medical field work.
   

  

* To evolve our scientific image in the field of fertility


 As part of the Swedish Medical Affairs team, you will focus on our portfolio of infertility treatments, develop and execute medical activities, bring insights to the cross-functional team, and provide medical and scientific input, always keeping the patient in mind. Collaboration, scientific leadership, customer centricity and a future-oriented mindset are keywords of this opening. Are you curious and does it resonate with your profile and ambition? If your answer is Yes, we are very keen to hear from you!
   

  

**Who You Are**
* You have a university degree in life sciences (MSc, MD, PhD, PharmD), preferably a Ph.D. or Medical Doctor.
* Scientific/clinical knowledge and previous experience in fertility.
* Professional experience of the Pharma Industry of at least 3-5 years. Prior experience and knowledge on study design and interpretation, Real-World Data, registry studies and publications is a plus.
* You are a positive team player, self-driven with excellent interpersonal capabilities to build effective partnerships with internal and external stakeholders. You have an ability to manage multiple tasks and tight deadlines in a dynamic environment, while maintaining focus and a forward thinking, customer centricity. You are curious and innovative and highly value teamwork.
* Excellent presentation and communication skills and you are fluent in Swedish and English.
* The position requires travelling.


**What we offer:** 
 We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe that this variety drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!
   

  

 Apply now and become a part of a team that is dedicated to Sparking Discovery and Elevating Humanity!

title: Operativ inköpare till Saab Surveillance
description:
**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Som operativ inköpare har du ansvaret för att säkerställa leverans av väsentligt planerade behov till vår produktion, som kännetecknas av stort projektfokus. Du kommer att ingå i ett team som köper material för både prototyper och mindre serietillverkning av tekniskt komplexa lösningar. Detta ställer höga krav på kvalitet, flexibilitet, teamwork och snabba åtgärder från både leverantörer och inköpare. Dina viktigaste gränssnitt, förutom leverantörerna, kommer att vara planering och flera olika projektkontor.
   

  

 Dina löpande arbetsuppgifter kommer främst att vara följande:
   

  

* Inköp av material och tjänster baserat på planerade behov
* Beställning och leveransuppföljning
* Inhämta kostnadsuppskattningar
* Löpande återkoppling till kundansvariga och hantering av leverantörsuppföljning
* Flödesoptimering


 Tjänsten är placerad i Järfälla. Avdelningen kommer flytta till nytt kontor i Solna under Q3/Q4 2025.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi önskar att du har en bakgrund inom operativt inköp alternativt har en hög teknisk utbildningsbakgrund som anses relevant.
   

  

 Du bör trivas med högt tempo och ha en god förståelse för de faktorer som styr inköp i leverantörskedjan. Du bör också kunna självständigt driva för att säkerställa god leveransprecision.
   

  

 För att lyckas och trivas hos oss, tror vi även att du är en prestigelös och lösningsorienterad person som kan agera i nuet samtidigt som du behåller fokus på målet. Du behöver vara ansvarstagande, proaktiv och ha en positiv attityd.
   

  

**Ansökningsförfarande**
 I denna rekryteringsprocess samarbetar Saab med Skill. Tjänsten är ett konsultuppdrag med övergång i en fortsatt anställning på Saab efter en tids inhyrning. Start för tjänsten är under hösten 2025, enligt ö.k.
   

  

 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Urvalsarbetet påbörjas med start v. 33. Vid frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Isabelle Wallin på mejl isabelle.wallin@skill.se
   

  

**Om företaget**
 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Affärsområde Surveillance erbjuder effektiva lösningar för övervakning och beslutsstöd, och system för att upptäcka och skydda mot olika typer av hot. Produktportföljen omfattar flygburna, landbaserade och marina radarsystem, system för signalspaning och självskydd, ledningssystem samt system för sjöfarts- och flygtrafikledning.
   

  

 Från rekrytering och bemanning till skräddarsydda utbildningar – på Skill ger vi människor förutsättningar att växa. För när människor växer, växer företag.
   

  

 Skill grundades 1997 och har ett brett tjänsteutbud inom rekrytering, bemanning, hr-tjänster och kompetensutveckling. Med en stark kundbas i teknik- och industriföretag samt inom IT och tech hjälper vi företag till rätt kompetens.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en kvalificerad rekryteringstjänst där vi adderar den kompetens du behöver för att ta din verksamhet vidare mot uppsatta mål. Vi erbjuder dessutom utbildningar som stärker befintliga medarbetare och konsulter.

title: Presales Lead Technical Architect (Swedish Speaker)
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.
   

  

 The
 **Northern Europe Technical Architect Team** 
 is a vibrant and dynamic part of our organization. Our mission is to help Salesforce customers and prospects understand and showcase how Salesforce’s solutions can drive real business value. We thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where each team member's unique contributions are key to our success.
   

  

 Architects are at the forefront of Salesforce's customer's success with Data and AI. We are the biggest technology evangelists and enablers, both internally and externally. We go the extra mile to understand the underlying technologies and competitive differentiators. Our team enables digital transformation through specialized domain expertise in Enterprise Architecture, Industry expertise, Business & Technical Architecture, Integration, AppDev, Security & Compliance, combined with deep technology insights, product skills, and IT stakeholder management. We lead with pride and integrity to deliver stakeholder success.
   

  

 As a premier Solution Engineering (pre-sales) team, we operate across Northern Europe, serving Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, Belgium, Luxembourg, and The Netherlands.
   

  

**Role Description**
 The Northern Europe Technical Architect is a customer-facing specialist position within the Solutions Engineering organization. With a blend of business, technical, and sales skills, the Technical Architect acts as a domain expert who utilizes a consultative approach to understand business and technical requirements. Technical Architects help the sales teams develop and refine a customer-centric technical sales strategy and Salesforce-solution fit.
   

  

**Skills**
 As a Technical Architect, you’ll act as a trusted advisor to our customers, guiding them through Agentforce, Data Cloud, CRM, and Platform solutions, ensuring they realize the full value of the platform. You’ll combine deep technical domain expertise in Data/AI/ML, data infrastructure, and CRM with strong presentation and solutioning skills. Working side by side with our Account Executives and Solutions Engineers, you will:
   

  

 Provide technical leadership during pre-sales engagements by assessing customer use cases, recommending optimal solutions, and shaping the overall technical vision.
   

  

* Champion best practices around Data/AI/ML, data integrations, security, and the Salesforce platform to drive innovation and customer adoption.
* Create and deliver relevant content—demos, videos, white-papers, enablement sessions—to both internal and external audiences, establishing yourself as a leader with vision.
* Build and present Proof of Concepts within sandbox environments to highlight the value of agents and unified customer data with real-world use cases.
* Understand a customer’s risk, security, or compliance concerns and communicate how Salesforce’s infrastructure, architecture, and application features can address these concerns.
* Understand current and emerging cybersecurity risks and innovative risk management methods and eloquently communicate them to customers.
* Partner with sales teams to remove security and compliance as a blocker by speaking to CISOs, CIOs, and other key decision-makers.


**Your Impact**
* Tackle Complex Problems: Research customer challenges, architect innovative solutions, and drive key technical decisions.
* Drive Adoption & Value: Promote platform adoption by driving additional business use cases with the customer.
* Showcase Real-World Solutions: Partner with Sales and Solutions Engineering to build compelling demos and prototypes that illustrate immediate ROI and practical use.
* Facilitate Workshops: Orchestrate targeted workshops that drive technical approaches and best practices aligned with the customer's defined business objectives and priorities.
* Develop Cross-Platform Solutions: Integrate Data Cloud, CRM, analytics tools, and cloud services (REST APIs, SDKs, data pipelines) into scalable, cohesive architectures.
* Lead Technical Thought Leadership: Produce best-practice documentation, architectural diagrams, and enablement materials that highlight emerging AI trends and Agentforce innovations.
* Learn & Tinker: Continually participate in product, sales, and training/certifications to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position.
* Security: Be a field expert for the Salesforce trust story covering security, architecture, reliability, performance, privacy, and compliance.
* Travel: Willing and able to travel to customers or Salesforce offices.


**Qualifications & Experience**
* A deep passion for working with the latest, cutting-edge technologies.
* Experience with cloud, SaaS, PaaS, aPaaS, and IaaS concepts and technologies.
* Familiarity with integration, security, and architecture patterns and expertise in designing and implementing data integrations across various systems.
* Proven experience presenting and demonstrating to senior business and technical stakeholders.
* Experience in facilitating and leading customer-focused workshops.
* Hands-on work with Generative AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), agent-based frameworks, and prompt engineering is a strong plus.
* Consultancy, development, and/or implementation experience is a strong plus.
* Solid experience with the Salesforce Platform (Platform Application Development experience would be a plus).
* Familiarity with one or more security and regulatory frameworks and trainings: NIST 800-53, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, PCI-DSS, ISO 27001, ISO 27017, ISO 27018, CCSP or CISSP is a plus


 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Barnskötare  vikariat
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Hägersten-Älvsjö är en av 11 stadsdelsförvaltningar i Stockholms stad med drygt 3000 medarbetare. I dag är vi ett av stadens största stadsdelsområden med ca 130 000 invånare. I Hägersten-Älvsjö har du nära till staden, kommunikationer och naturen. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsplats med möjligheter för dig att utvecklas i din roll.
   

  

 Den kommunala förskoleverksamheten hos oss är den största i Stockholms stad och vi arbetar kontinuerligt och systematiskt med verksamhetens utveckling utifrån det kompetenta barnet och en lärande organisation.
   

  

 Välkommen till oss
   

  

 Som barnskötare är du anställd inom en förskoleenhet där det finns flera förskolor.
   

  

 Som barnskötare och medarbetare i Stockholms stad medverkar du aktivt till att utveckla verksamheten, är insatt i verksamhetens mål och styrdokument, såväl nationella som lokala.
   

  

 Nu söker vi barnskötare till område 7. I området finns det 11 förskolor som ligger belägna i Årstaberg och Årstadal. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och skapa de bästa förutsättningarna för våra yngsta stockholmare. Du ser möjligheter istället för hinder och har barnen i fokus. Ditt förhållningssätt ger förutsättningar för att öka tillgängligheten för ett inkluderande arbetssätt.
   

  

 Tjänsten är ett vikariat för höstterminen med start 11 augusti 2025 därav kommer urvalet ske löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi erbjuder
   

  

 Som barnskötare är du en del i det systematiska kvalitetsarbetet. Där ingår att bidra till att planera, genomföra, följa upp och utveckla arbetet på förskolan så att omsorg, utveckling och lärande bildar en helhet i enlighet med läroplanens mål och intentioner.
   

  

 Du får även arbetskläder för uteverksamhet och pedagogiska måltider.
   

  

 Din roll
   

  

 Som barnskötare är du en del i ett arbetslag som leds av en förskollärare i målstyda processer utifrån läroplansuppdraget och vår verksamhetsplan. Du ska delta i planeringen, praktiskt genomföra, följa upp utbildning och undervisning utifrån läroplanen. Du är delaktig i att alla barn utmanas och stimuleras i sin utveckling med ett reellt inflytande.
   

  

 Som barnskötare är du med och bidrar till barnens utveckling och lärande. Du medverkar till en positiv och utvecklande miljö med en god balans av omsorg och lärande.
   

  

 Du medverkar även till en god arbetsmiljö för dig och dina kollegor.
   

  

 Du ska även:
   

  

* Samverka med vårdnadshavare i enlighet med nationella mål.
* Aktivt delta i arbetet med aktiva åtgärder och mot kränkande behandling.
* Aktivt medverka i arbetet för barnsäkerhet.
* bidra till dokumentationen av barns lärande, uppföljning och analys.


 Din kompetens och erfarenhet
   

  

 Du är utbildad barnskötare med minst 2 års erfarenhet av yrket.
   

  

 Du har även:
   

  

* erfarenhet av arbete med barn i behov av särskilt stöd
* kunskap och erfarenhet av arbete i Skolplattformen eller liknande digitala system
* Fördjupade kunskaper i nationella styrdokument som skollag, läroplan och barnkonvention
* Behärska svenska språket väl i både tal och skrift
* Goda IT-kunskaper i Office-paketet samt digitala mötesappar


 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid följande personliga förmågor och färdigheter: Du har ett barnfokus som är tydligt och återspeglas i ditt förhållningssätt i vardagen genom att du praktiserar ett lyssnande och nära ledarskap där barnens inflytande är centralt.
   

  

 Du är en aktiv pedagog som alltid befinner dig nära barnen och både deltar och initierar lek både spontant och som en del av den planerade undervisningen. Din samarbetsförmåga är mycket god och du är lyhörd och inkännande i ditt bemötande av barn, vårdnadshavare och kollegor.
   

  

**Som barnskötare ingår att:**
* Samverka med kollegor, ledning och vårdnadshavare
* Aktivt delta i alla delar av barnens utbildning
* Bidra till en verksamhet som är meningsfull, rolig och trygg för alla barn
* Vara delaktig i dokumentationen av barns lärande och bidra till uppföljning och analys
* Sköta dagliga administrativa uppgifter som mejl, närvarohantering och rapportering
* Aktivt delta i arbetet med aktiva åtgärder och kränkande behandling
* Aktivt medverka i arbetet för barnsäkerhet


 Annat
   

  

* Delta i APT-möten, nätverk och pedagogiska forum
* Delta i kompetensutveckling
* Vid behov samverka med andra aktörer som exempelvis skola, socialtjänst, polis och habilitering


**Din kompetens och erfarenhet**
* Gymnasieutbildning barn och fritidsprogrammet 2500 p


 alternativt Gymnasieutbildning 2500p med kompletterande
   

  

 KY-utbildning för barnskötare 1300p
   

  

 alternativt examensbevis från Stockholm Stads anordnade yrkesutbildning till barnskötare
   

  

**Meriterande utbildning:**
* TAKK
* Utbildning inom barn i behov av särskilt stöd, BIBASS


**Meriterande erfarenhet:**
* Erfarenhet av BIBASS


**Nödvändig kunskap:**
* Behärska svenska språket väl i tal och skrift
* Insatt i Läroplanen för förskolan, Barnkonvention och Skollag
* Grundläggande IT-kunskaper


**Meriterande kunskap:**
* Kunskap och erfarenhet BIBASS


 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/4095 | Kontakt: Linn Hägglund 08-50822764, | Facklig företrädare: Piero Cima, | Publicerat: 2025-06-27 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-07-25

title: Senior Manager, Field Engineering (Remote, EMEA)
description:
As a Senior Manager of Field Engineering at Grafana Labs, you will be responsible for all aspects of building and managing a team of high-performing Field Engineers. The Field Engineering team are solution SMEs for Grafana responsible for accelerating, scaling and improving the path to the technical win. You will oversee the global GTM execution with your sales leader counterparts, with a focus on helping us acquire new customers and building tools that accelerate our path to the technical win. You will coach and grow a diverse team of Field Engineers. You will work with the Solutions Engineering team to get requirements to maintain our comprehensive Demo environment. You’ll work with marketing to drive top of funnel programs leveraging the workshops the FE team creates and maintains. You’ll also work closely with Product Management and Engineering to ensure that we are constantly delivering value to our customers by influencing the roadmap, based on feedback from the field, as well as leveraging your own experience in the Observability and customer ecosystem. Your impact will be felt globally when the job is done well.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Attract, recruit, ramp, and mentor a team of great Field Engineers from diverse backgrounds and experiences.
* Get the best out of your team with an individual coaching mindset.
* Balance the workload of your team across account engagement, project development and maintenance, engineering engagement, competitive intelligence, conferences and enablement.
* Direct the bulk of your day-to-day work based on guidance and goals from your leadership, owning the planning, actions and outcomes of the team.
* Culture carrier who values the team over the individual and values; getting to the right answer is more important than being right
* Defaults to teamwork and collaboration; strong cross-functional relationship builder

Flexible, but not afraid of a healthy debate * - brings a strong point of view, but open to considering alternatives
* Partner with Sales leadership on top of funnel programs, marketing initiatives and community/company events to drive awareness of Grafana’s brand and the problems we help solve.
* Understanding your key customers’ strategies for adoption of Grafana technologies and developing programs and collateral to enable them to be successful.
* Ensure that your customers’ requirements are being met with our product through partnership with Product Management and Engineering
* Own and report on the quarter over quarter cadence of your team while they help prospects evaluate our software with discovery, demonstrations, key stakeholder interviews, workshops and technical validation, including POVs and Mutual Account Plans


**Requirements**


* 10+ years in the high tech industry having held roles such as Developer, Sales Engineer/Architect, SRE, Manager, etc.
* 5+ years of People Management experience in a sales organization
* Direct experience mentoring, developing people and managing performance over time.
* Direct experience selling monitoring/data/visualization products.
* Experience in Open Source selling or Cloud first/Product led sales go to market motion a big plus.
* Direct experience implementing and/or executing a formal sales methodology, Command of the Message, qualification frameworks like MEDDPICC.
* Direct experience selling monitoring/data/visualization products.
* Direct experience in DevOps (IaC, CI/CD, GitHub Actions, etc) a plus
* Experience with complex, enterprise sales


In Sweden, the OTE compensation range for this role is SEK 1,186,000 - SEK 1,424,000. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable), and other benefits listed on our careers page.


* *Compensation ranges are country specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.*
  


**About Grafana Labs:** There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies - including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay - manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).  



**Equal Opportunity Employer:** At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.

*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our* *privacy policy**.*
