title: Senior Solutions Engineer
description:
**Overview**
------------


At NetApp, we have a history of helping customers turn challenges into business opportunities. As part of our sales organization, your role will require a strategic blend of technical acumen and charismatic client engagement, ensuring that every partnership is nurtured towards it maximum potential. As a pivotal link between NetApp and our clients, your contributions will directly influence the growth and direction of our department, making a lasting impact on the organization's success. This is more than a job—it's a chance to be part of a team that values innovation, supports professional growth, and celebrates shared victories.
  
**About NetApp**


NetApp is the intelligent data infrastructure company, turning a world of disruption into opportunity for every customer. No matter the data type, workload or environment, we help our customers identify and realize new business possibilities. And it all starts with our people.


If this sounds like something you want to be part of, NetApp is the place for you. You can help bring new ideas to life, approaching each challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, you won't be doing it alone. At NetApp, we're all about asking for help when we need it, collaborating with others, and partnering across the organization - and beyond.




**Job summary**
---------------


As a Senior Solutions Engineer, you determine customer needs for solutions and services from NetApp. You analyze customer requirements and convert them into technical solution concepts. You can present NetApp technologies to customers at different levels of responsibility, adapt to the interlocutors and question their motives and motivational factors. You not only support sales in the first technical customer discussions but are also responsible for the technical elaboration of the solutions offered.


**Your area of responsibility**
-------------------------------


Your area of responsibility includes the technical representation of NetApp and in particular the analysis of existing cloud, IT, network, application, backup and storage landscapes at customers. In the role of a Trusted Advisor, you are responsible for developing solution concepts and architectures, which you will present to a larger audience as part of a technical customer presentation. Active contact with customers in cooperation with the responsible Client Executive and ensuring that technically complex inquiries are handled competently and implemented professionally are the focus of this task.

**Your profile**
----------------


Are you enthusiastic about innovative technology and would you like to constantly develop yourself?  

Do you find it easy to explain complex issues and do you find yourself in the following points?

* Interest in current trends in IT and technologies used (e.g. public clouds, hybrid clouds, container technologies, DevOps concepts, artificial intelligence)
* High motivation to actively advise our customers on their path to digital transformation and to develop joint solutions
* You can think analytically, are creative and team-oriented
* You like to bring different people together and work towards a common goal
* IT knowledge, including in enterprise/cloud computing, virtualization, storage, backup or high availability solutions
* Knowledge of storage technologies is desirable
* Successfully completed technical training or technical studies with appropriate professional experience
* Very good knowledge of Swedish and English Language


At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.


At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.


**Equal Opportunity Employer:**


NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, and any protected classification.

**Why NetApp?**


In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world's biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.


We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favourite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.


If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.


**Submitting an application**  

  

To ensure a streamlined and fair hiring process for all candidates, our team only reviews applications submitted through our company website. This practice allows us to track, assess, and respond to applicants efficiently. Emailing our employees, recruiters, or Human Resources personnel directly will not influence your application.


  
**Our values**
--------------


Put the customer at the center. Care for each other and our communities. Think and act like owners. Build belonging every day. Embrace a growth mindset.


  
**Benefits**
------------


### **Volunteer time off**


40 hours of paid volunteer time each year.
### **Well-being**


Employee Assistance Program, fitness, and mental health resources to help employees be their best.
### **Time away**


Paid time off for vacation and to recharge.

title: Teknisk Specialist (Sysadmin/DevOps) med fokus på Automation & AI
description:
Vill du jobba på ett företag där du kan se resultatet av ditt arbete varje dag? Välkommen till Hostup, där vi växer med flera hundra nya kunder varje månad (majoritet VPS) och där teknisk innovation är kärnan i allt vi gör.
  
Vi tror på att automatisera allt som kan automatiseras. Vår filosofi är enkel: smarta system och automation ger oss tid att fokusera på det som är genuint roligt – att bygga klassledande hostingtjänster. Vi expanderar nu vårt team och söker vår första heltidsanställda tekniska specialist. Du kommer att bli en grundpelare i vår verksamhet och få en unik chans att växa med oss.
  
Om Rollen
  
Som vår tekniska expert kommer du att arbeta tätt tillsammans med mig, bolagets grundare. Din roll blir en spännande mix av daglig drift och strategisk utveckling. Du kommer att vara den tekniska klippan som våra kunder och system litar på. Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
  
Hantera våra tekniska supportärenden. Allt från enklare kundfrågor om cPanel, e-post och hemsidor till komplexa felsökningar och de eskaleringar som kräver djup systemkunskap.
  
Identifiera, designa och bygga nya automatiserade lösningar. Du får frihet att optimera allt från provisionering av en VPS till smartare kunduppföljning. Automation is king!
  
Hantera och utveckla vår infrastruktur. Detta inkluderar vår virtualiseringsmiljö (Proxmox/KVM) och den fysiska hårdvaran i våra datacenter.
  
  

Vem är du? – Vi värderar din passion och problemlösningsförmåga högst.
  
**Glöm det perfekta CV:** t. Vi är övertygade om att ett brinnande intresse och en dokumenterad förmåga att lösa problem är det som räknas. Om du har ett imponerande homelab eller har lärt dig allt du kan på egen hand, då är vi väldigt intresserade.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Älskar att lösa problem. Du gräver tills du hittar grundorsaken och nöjer dig inte med en snabbfix.
  
Är självgående och nyfiken. Du tar egna initiativ och lär dig ständigt nya saker.
  
Har mycket goda praktiska kunskaper inom Linux och känner dig hemma i terminalen.
  
Har erfarenhet av virtualisering (KVM, Proxmox) och webbserver-teknik (Apache/Nginx, PHP, MySQL, cPanel).
  
Ser moderna AI-verktyg (som ChatGPT/Gemini) som en självklar del av din verktygslåda. Du förstår att man måste förstå koden, inte bara kopiera den, för att jobba snabbt och effektivt.
  
  

**Extra meriterande (och väldigt coolt om du har erfarenhet av):**
  
**Datacenter & Hårdvara:** Du tycker det är genuint roligt att "mecka med hårdvara". Vi har vår utrustning i Equinix SK2 i Stockholm, och det är ett enormt plus om du har möjlighet och vilja att åka dit för att bygga nya servrar, byta komponenter eller felsöka. Bostadsort i närheten är en bonus, men viljan att resa dit är det viktiga.
  
**Avancerad nätverkning:** Kunskap om BGP, routing (gärna erfarenhet av Cisco Nexus eller liknande), och att bygga hobbynät.
  
**Scripting:** Goda kunskaper i Python eller Bash för att bygga automatiserade lösningar.
  
  

Vad vi erbjuder dig
  
**En unik nyckelroll:** Du blir en grundpelare i vårt lilla, teknikdrivna team och får en oslagbar möjlighet att påverka och växa med ett redan lönsamt och snabbväxande företag.
  
**Teknik i framkant:** Du får arbeta med moderna tekniker och en utpräglad "automation-first"-filosofi.
  
**Flexibilitet och frihet:** Arbeta helt på distans, eller från vår kontorsplats på DoSpace i Linköping. Du väljer det som passar dig bäst.
  
**Personlig och professionell utveckling:** Följ med på branschevenemang som CloudFest, Domain-Days och Internetstiftelsens möten om du vill. Vi investerar i din kunskap.
  
**Trygghet och konkurrenskraftiga villkor:** En tillsvidareanställning med marknadsmässig lön och allt som hör till.
  
  

Ansökan
  
Låter det här som du? Skicka ditt CV och ett kort personligt brev till david.berndtsson@hostup.se. Berätta varför du är rätt person för oss. Har du ett homelab, ett GitHub-konto eller något annat spännande hobbyprojekt du är stolt över – skicka med en länk!
  
Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  
Med vänliga hälsningar,
  
David Berndtsson (Grundare @ Hostup AB)
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Partneruppdrag Prevas - Teknikspecialist OpenShift
description:
**Till kundspecifika uppdrag söker vi nu en** ***Teknikspecialist OpenShift*****, kompetensnivå 3.**

**Bakgrund**


Förvaltningsobjektet IT-arbetsplats genomgår just nu en transformation till nästa generations Digitala arbetsplats/Digital Workplace. I detta arbete behövs en applikationsansvarig som har god teknisk kompetens och erfarenhet av drift och förvaltning av samarbetsplattformar, t.ex. Rocket.Chat och Collaboard. Du blir en viktig spelare i att säkerställa stabilitet, tillgänglighet och vidareutveckling av dessa applikationer inom en säker och modern infrastruktur.

**Uppdragsbeskrivning**


I rollen som applikationsansvarig ansvarar du för den tekniska förvaltningen av ett eller flera system kopplat till samarbete och kommunikation. Du kommer arbeta nära både infrastrukturteam, säkerhetsfunktioner och andra teknikansvariga för att säkerställa att systemen är uppdaterade, säkra och anpassade efter verksamhetens behov.

**I uppdraget ingår följande arbetsuppgifter:**

* Installation, konfiguration och förvaltning av applikationer såsom Rocket.Chat, Collaboard och andra samarbetsverktyg
* Använda ArgoCD och Helm för deployment och uppgradering av applikationer i containerbaserade miljöer (OpenShift)
* Felsökning samt analys och optimering av applikationer
* Uppgradering av applikationer samt hantera incidenter
* Dokumentation av applikationer, tekniska guider och förvaltning
* Upplärning av intern personal inom support och förvaltning
* Samverka med andra applikations- och systemansvariga samt bidra till förbättringar inom förvaltningsprocesser
* Säkerställa att applikationerna fungerar enligt krav på säkerhet, prestanda och tillgänglighet

**Obligatoriska** *k***unskaps krav:**

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av teknisk systemförvaltning, drift eller DevOps-liknande arbete.
* *erfarenhet av arbete i containerteknik, OpenShift och Kubernetes, inklusive Helm.*
* *erfarenhet av arbete i säkerhetskritisk miljö med minst 500 användare.*
* *ska ha praktisk erfarenhet av att hantera kubernetes-applikationer med ArgoCD och Helm*
* *Minst 3 års erfarenhet av arbete med digitala samarbetsplattformar inom större organisationer*

*Personliga egenskaper för att lyckas i detta uppdrag*

* *Samarbetsförmåga och initiativförmåga*
* *Flexibel och anpassningsbar efter arbetsbelastning*
* *Utåtriktad och tydlig i sin kommunikation*
* *Ödmjuk och ha lätt för att skapa förtroende*
* *Arbetar självständigt och målinriktat*
* *Fallenhet för administrativa arbetsuppgifter*
* *Förmåga att jobba i grupp*
* 

**Geografi**: Sundbyberg, (minst 60% på plats)  

**Preliminärt startdatum**: 2025-10-01  

**Slutdatum**: 2027-07-14  

**Option**: förlänga kan ske med 2 år + 1 år + 1år, dvs. längst t.o.m. 2029-06-30  

**Omfattning**: 100 procent.


Sista ansökningsdag: *2025-08-30. Vi presenterar kandidater löpande för uppdragsgivaren, dvs före sista ansökningsdatum.*


Kontaktperson på Prevas: *Patrik Åkerlind*

  

Om du är intresserad av uppdraget visar du intresse genom att ansöka via knapparna nedan. Vi kommer inom kort höra av oss till de kandidater som är mest lämpade för uppdraget.


Processen för partneruppdrag går ofta snabbt så skicka din intresseanmälan så snart som möjligt.


Välkommen med din intresseanmälan!-

title: Machine Learning Engineer | Stockholm
description:
**AI + Apotea =**  

Apotea is Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare accessible and efficient for everyone. Our Data and AI team is at the heart of innovation, building AI and ML applications that enhance customer experience, streamline operations, and create a foundation for future innovations. we are seeking passionate and driven individuals who are eager to make a significant impact and be part of a small technical team. By following industry best practices, we develop end to end AI applications on top of modern data and AI architectures, making sure our AI products don't end up just being a POC and drive sustainable value in production. The AI organization sits right under CEO Pär Svärdson, ensuring that your work has high visibility and significant influence.

 **Your role as a Machine Learning Engineer at Apotea**:

  

* **Build, deploy, and own end-to-end ML systems** – from prototyping to maintaining production models, ensuring scalability, reliability, and alignment with team strategy.
* **Turn models into real-world solutions** – integrate ML into products that deliver measurable business value.
* **Apply MLOps and DevOps best practices** – use CI/CD, IaC, and cloud native solutions to deploy and monitor models.
* **Collaborate across teams** – work with Data Engineers, Software Engineers, Tech Lead, and Product Owner to align on data, integrations, architecture, and goals.
* **Define metrics and evaluation processes** - establish performance metrics, evaluation and validation frameworks aligned with business logic and requirements
* **Take proactive initiatives** - continuously identify and implement improvements to boost team productivity and solution quality
* **Mentor junior engineers** - provide technical guidance, code reviews, and care for the junior engineers in the team.

**Who you are?**  

We’re seeking Machine Learning Engineers with diverse skills and a passion for solving complex problems and business impact.

  


* **You’re an ML EXPERT who:**  

	+ Ships models to production, not just notebooks
	+ Speaks the language of both algorithms and business KPIs
	+ Stays ahead of the curve on AI/ML breakthroughs
	+ Is proficient in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.


* **You’re an ENGINEER who:**  

	+ Writes code that outlasts the current project
	+ Thinks in systems, not just scripts
	+ Tests obsessively (A/B testing solutions, End-to-End testing softwares) and documents proactively
	+ Knows cloud infra like the back of your hand (AWS preferred)


* **Bonus points for experience with:**  

	+ Implementing CI/CD pipelines, MLOps practices, and infrastructure-as-code for robust and repeatable deployments
	+ Feature stores and real-time inference pipelines
	+ Open data formats like Delta Lake or Iceberg
	+ Swedish language skills (not required, but a plus)
**What Apotea Offer You**

* The chance to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that impact millions of customers.
* Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
* Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics
* Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
* Own projects from concept to deployment
* A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.

**About Apotea**  

Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.  

  

Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.

title: Platform engineer (remote Sweden / Stockholm)
description:
QBank is looking for an ambitious platform engineer with a focus on automation and infrastructure.  This is a great opportunity to become part of a successful SaaS company within the Digital Asset Management (DAM) space. You will be part of a cross functional team working with developing new features and functionality in our platform along with integrations and maintenance.
 





 For this role we are looking for a candidate that either lives in Stockholm or that can work remotely from within Sweden.
 





  
 




**What you will be doing** 



* Work closely with SRE, Head of Product and CTO to meet customer expectations and requirements in terms of uptime and automation.
* Be a key player in shipping new functionality to QBank customers.
* Work closely with the rest of the team and the CTO to enhance the platform architecture, with an opportunity to influence the long term direction.
* Work with challenging assignments in an environment that promotes personal skill growth



  





**Who are you?** 



* You are motivated by delivering solutions that emphasize quality and customer satisfaction
* You are passionate about writing qualitative, modular and loosely coupled code.
* You are a fast learner and have the ability to use what you have learned to improve existing implementations
* You are a team player, but can also drive implementation projects on your own


- 


**Required skills** 



* Excellent knowledge of scripting languages like bash or Python.
* Excellent knowledge Kubernetes and Docker
* Excellent knowledge of infrastructure as code in general and Terraform in particular.
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish
* Excellent knowledge of AWS
* Strong knowledge about CI/CD
* Strong knowledge about observability tooling, such as Prometheus, the ELK stack and OTEL
* Strong knowledge about system administration in Linux
* Strong knowledge about relational databases in general and Postgresql in particular.
* Strong knowledge about common programming patterns and paradigms, such as object oriented programming (OOP) and functional programming



  





**Desired skills** 



* Experience with version management in general and Git in particular
* Experience with agile methodologies
* Experience with event buses like Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ or similar
* Experience with networking in IPV4 and IPV6



  





**About QBank** 




  






 QBank is a successful SaaS company within Digital Asset Management. Our main focus is on the Nordic market, but we also serve international customers around the globe. We are a team of 25 highly engaged and skilled people. We are working from an office in central Stockholm with great communications.
 




  






 QBank provides enterprise customers with central management and distribution of digital assets, often with integration to business-critical solutions such as PIM, ERP, MDM, E-commerce platforms, Social Media platforms etc

title: DevSecOps Engineer

description:
**About the company** 




*Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.* 




  





*Our career page:
 
 https://jobs.worldline.com/*




  





**Your role** 




 In the position as DevSecOps you will build, operate and secure technical systems and infrastructure in an environment where payments and data security are at the core.
 



  





**Main tasks and responsibilities** 



* Lead hands-on PCI-DSS assessments, ensuring compliance and successful audits.
* Lead and advice about the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of infrastructure security practices.



  





**We offer you** 




 Perks & Benefits at Worldline:
 


* Pension plan
* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.
* Hybrid working model (50% from the office, flexible on the days)



  





 Office location: Hammarby Kaj 10D, Stockholm
 



  





**Your qualifications** 



* Comprehensive understanding of PCI-DSS requirements and compliance processes
* Strong proficiency with Linux environments
* Hands-on experience with Terraform
* Practical hands-on engineering experience for finding proactive solution
* Fluent in English. Swedish language skills are a significant advantage
* Good interpersonal and teamwork skills



 In addition to the above, we would like you to have a minimum of 2 years of recent experience, particularly related to the transition from PCI DSS version 3 to version 4. Ideally, you have amoung 10 years of experience in software development or infrastructure.
 



  





**About Clevry** 




*For over 30 years we have been the change maker for a more soft skills driven work-life within talent acquisition, assessments and advisory. We operate globally with customers, consultants and candidates from North America to Singapore with headquarters in Brighton, Stockholm and Helsinki. At Clevry we have over 150 soft skills certified recruiters, business psychologists and experts at your service.* 




  





**The process** 




 In this recruitment process, Worldline is collaborating with the consulting and recruitment company Clevry, which will handle the initial phone interview.
 



  





 As part of this process, our client will conduct a background check on the final candidate.
 



  





 We apply continuous selection, and the position may be filled before the application deadline. We warmly welcome your application already today!
 



  





**Please note!** 
 We only accept applications submitted through our platform and will not respond to applications sent via email.
 



  





*Follow us on LinkedIn:
 
 Clevry Sweden*

title: Cloud Architect - Data & AI
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and IT Services and IT Consulting

 You’ll play a central role in developing cloud infrastructure for data pipelines, machine learning operations, and large-scale analytics. title: Service Delivery Engineer
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As our Service Delivery Engineer at Xensam, you’ll be at the intersection of technology and customer experience, ensuring smooth delivery, configuration, and support of our solutions to clients across industries. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to implement services, tailor custom development to client needs, resolve issues, and help drive continuous improvement in delivery processes.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 You’ll design, develop, debug, test, and maintain integrations of our services into customer environments. You will also maintain and enhance our Integration Platform, ensuring stability while continuously delivering new features and improvements. Furthermore, you will:
 



  




* Own and manage the end-to-end technical delivery of our platform or services to customers.
* Collaborate with Sales, Support, and Product teams to ensure smooth onboarding and configuration.
* Act as a trusted technical advisor to clients post-sale, ensuring their environments are correctly set up and optimized.
* Troubleshoot and resolve incidents or performance issues, escalating where needed.
* Monitor delivery SLAs and report on service health and incident trends.
* Document processes, deployment configurations, and best practices.
* Continuously identify ways to improve reliability, scalability, and customer experience.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 3–5 years of experience in software development, service delivery or customer-facing engineering roles.
* Preferably a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
* Strong proficiency programming in JavaScript, with experience debugging and enhancing browser-based or platform-integrated tools.
* Solid understanding of REST APIs, including how to consume, debug, and troubleshoot API-based integrations using JSON.
* Good working knowledge of relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and experience querying or inspecting data.
* Familiarity with authentication protocols such as OAuth2, OpenID Connect (OIDC), JWT, and Access Tokens.
* Comfortable using ticketing systems and collaboration platforms.
* A proactive mindset, strong attention to detail, and a passion for solving customer problems.
* Good communication skills and a strong proficiency in written and spoken English.



  





**Bonus Points If You Have** 



* Experience with Node-RED.



  





**What You Get** 



* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* A generous work culture with free access to drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* Other location-specific benefits.



  





**At Xensam, Our Core Values Define Our Culture** 




**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
 



**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
 



 Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive,
 **APPLY now!** 




  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Data Engineer – Stockholm** 




  





 We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data & Machine Learning team and help us take our data infrastructure to the next level.
 



  





**The Role** 




 Data is core to how we build products and make decisions. Our Data & Machine Learning team is now looking for a standout Data Engineer to help drive the continual evolution of our data platform. We have a clear and ambitious vision, and you will play a key role in making it real. You’ll enjoy autonomy with accountability, and work in an environment where the time from idea to execution is shorter than in most places. You’ll also be part of a team that is focused on creating value and making a real impact.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Design, build, maintain, and evolve scalable, reliable data solutions that power decision-making and machine learning.
* Own the data platform: drive strategic improvements while delivering on day-to-day needs (e.g. building pipelines, refactoring, simplifying systems).
* Shape and drive the data platform strategy, from architecture to tooling.
* Collaborate with engineers, analysts, and data scientists to ensure data trustworthiness.
* Ensure data quality through smart monitoring, testing, and governance.
* Move fast, learn continuously, and reduce time from idea to impact.
* Share ideas and challenge assumptions to ensure we’re doing the right things.



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




  




* Solid experience in data engineering with strong Python and SQL skills.
* Proficient in orchestration tools like Apache Airflow.
* Experienced with data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery).
* Comfortable with both streaming and batch data processing.
* Strong understanding of cloud platforms (GCP and/or AWS).
* Familiar with Terraform and Kubernetes.
* Experience with Docker and containerised workflows.
* Skilled in CI/CD for data workflows.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
* Bonus: Experience with dbt (Data Build Tool).



  





**Why Join Us?** 




  




* Be part of a fast-paced environment where data drives everything.
* Join a highly competent, collaborative, and supportive team.
* Work on high-impact initiatives with real business value.
* Enjoy a culture that values learning, experimentation, and innovation.
* Benefit from flexible work arrangements, competitive salary, and a great team culture.

title: Storage Solutions Engineer
description:
As part of our growing Energy Storage team, we are now looking for a
 **Storage Optimization Engineer** 
 to optimize our battery storage projects, both standalone and hybrid, for long-term value and performance.
 



  





**About the role** 




 You will work at the intersection of technology and commercial strategy, ensuring our storage projects are technically sound and financially optimized. This role involves close collaboration across OX2’s functions including Investments, Power Markets, Procurement, and Development.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Optimize storage system design considering both technical and commercial aspects
* Support project sizing, augmentation strategies, and hybrid system design
* Identify and solve grid-related and market-driven design challenges
* Bridge technical design with market and revenue modelling
* Contribute to due diligence and investment analysis
* Develop tools and documentation to support decision-making and knowledge sharing



  





**About you** 




 We’re looking for someone structured, analytical, and collaborative, with a passion for energy innovation. You likely have:
 



  




* A degree in Engineering, Economics, or a related field
* 3+ years of experience in energy storage or renewable energy
* Solid understanding of both technical systems and market dynamics
* Strong communication skills and fluency in English. Additional languages such as Swedish, Finnish, Italian or Polish are a plus
* Experience working cross-functionally in international teams
* A proactive, solution-oriented mindset



  





**Location & travel** 




 The role is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 or another OX2 office, occasional
 **travel up to 15%** 
 may be required.
 



  





**About OX2** 




 OX2 develops, constructs, sells, owns, and operates renewable energy solutions at scale. OX2’s project development portfolio consists of in-house development as well as acquired projects in onshore and offshore wind, solar, and energy storage, in various phases of development. OX2 operates across Europe and in Australia. The company has about 500 employees and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. OX2 is owned by EQT, one of the world’s largest private equity investors. www.ox2.com

title: Data Engineer Insight
description:

**Do you want to build the next datamodels för AI, ML and datawarehouse empowered solutions?**
 Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. title: Senior Solutions Architect, Public Sector Sweden
description:
**Description**
 We are looking for a skilled, self-motivated technologist to join a team of supportive, experienced technology professionals. As a Senior Solutions Architect in the Public Sector team, you get to impact the lives of millions of citizens and help a variety of different customers - all the way from digital-native and government-linked companies to security-focused government agencies. Overall, the customers we work with include government agencies, state-owned companies, educational institutions, healthcare and non-profit organizations. Our Public Sector teams help customers build a deeper understanding of hyper-scale cloud technology and application architectures, and they have the consultative skills required to drive successful outcomes.
   

  

 Solutions Architects own the overall technical relationship between customers and AWS and make recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency. They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. To do this they collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, support, product teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.
   

  

 In this role you will get to practice your creativity, linking technology to tangible solutions and educating Swedish AWS customers about the art of the possible. You will have the opportunity to define or invent cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn.
   

  

 You will have the support to grow your expertise in industry and technology areas of depth. Every day you will learn something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments. At Amazon you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* The right person will be highly technical and analytical, possess significant experience of software development and/or IT and networking implementation as well security and compliance
* Strong knowledge of application architecture, software development, server, networking, security
* Presentation and communication skills with the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
* Swedish language fluent
* Understanding of government certification and compliance landscape


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Working knowledge of modern software development practices and technologies such as agile methodologies and DevOps is highly desired.
* Experience in writing, publishing technical whitepapers, and evangelizing.
* Experience with the adoption of modern applications in the cloud, offering guidance on best practices, scalability, and security
* Bachelor’s degree, certifications, or similar experiences desired
* Experience from National Security and/or Defense is a merit


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2992721

title: Integration Specialist – Stockholm
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Design Services
description:
Befinner du dig i ett flow när du får jobba med systemintegration och moderna API-centriska lösningar? Kanske trivs du ännu mer då du får jobba med trevliga teammedlemmar och ha kul tillsammans i utmanande uppdrag? Vi vill nu bli fler i vårt Connectivity-team i Sverige – kanske är du vår nästa kollega?
   

  

 På Solita har vi över 20 års erfarenhet av integration och processautomation – och vår passion för att hjälpa kunder att skapa robusta, skalbara och framtidssäkra lösningar är lika stark idag som när vi började. Våra integrationsspecialister arbetar nära våra kunder för att förstå deras unika behov. Genom att använda den senaste tekniken inom API-design, molnintegration och DevOps säkerställer vi inte bara snabb leverans av affärsvärde, utan också effektiva kopplingar mellan system och dataflöden.
   

  

 En dag på Solita
   

  

 En dag på Solita kan ofta börja med ett standup-möte med kund och dina team-medlemmar, där ni planerar dagens arbete, går igenom prioriteringar och identifierar eventuella utmaningar. Sen kliver du in i ditt arbete: kanske jobbar du med att utveckla integrationer och API:er i exempelvis Azure, migrera integrationer mellan olika plattformar, eller fokuserar på att skissa upp en integrationslösning baserat på en kravspec. Under dagen kan det dyka upp ad-hoc möten med kund eller kollegor som behöver stöttning i sitt arbete. Ofta innebär det att lösa problem: kanske behöver du felsöka en oväntad driftstörning, identifiera en flaskhals i ett integrationsflöde eller hitta en ny väg för att möta kundens krav.
   

  

 Du kan också delta i våra interna utbildningsmöten, så kallade infosessions, där vi delar kunskap om allt från nya teknologier till banbrytande arbetssätt. Dagen fortsätter med utveckling och kanske ett par korta avstämningar och inte minst – fika!
   

  

**Emma Fägerlind** 
 som jobbar som Integration Lead hos oss, beskriver sitt nuvarande uppdrag:
   

  

*“Mitt team bygger integrationer som ska stödja HR- och ekonomiprocesser för en kommun. Som integrationsledare har jag en blandad roll där jag både får arbeta med samordning, funktionskrav och teknisk lösning. Jag hjälper att ta fram specifikationer och förstå vad det är vi behöver göra för att lösa kundens behov. När är vi stöter på problem eller frågor försöker få jag teamet att komma framåt genom att lyfta frågor till relevanta parter.*
*Problemlösningen är det roligaste i mitt jobb – att få sätta sig in i nya flöden och tekniker och tillsammans med andra försöka hitta den lämpligaste lösningen. Det är fantastiskt att få vara del av ett team och se hur olika personers egenskaper bidrar på olika sätt till resultatet.”*
**Din roll som Integration Specialist**
 Hos Oss Får Du Möjligheten Att Jobba Teamorienterat i Meningsfulla Och Kundnära Projekt. Som Integrationskonsult Hos Oss Har Du Möjlighet Att Utvecklas Inom Följande Ansvarsområden
   

  

**Integration & API developer** 
 – Detta är en mer renodlad utvecklingsroll med fokus på att bygga och testa diverse molnbaserade integrations- och plattformslösningar. Du använder problemlösning och förståelse för affärsprocesser för att definiera optimala lösningar för kunder, samt ansvarar för implementeringen av lösningar enligt projektkraven. Tidigare erfarenhet av systemutveckling och förmåga att utveckla och implementera diverse integrationslösningar hjälper dig att ta dig an denna roll.
   

  

**Integration lead** 
 – I denna roll har du chansen att jobba närmare verksamheten där du i dialog med kundens verksamhet och andra system tar fram krav på integrationer, leder integrationsarbetet och tester av integrationer. Här ser vi gärna att du är familjär med integrationskoncept och har tidigare erfarenhet i en teknisk och kundnära roll där du jobbat med kravhantering samt teknisk design av integrationer.
   

  

**Integration architect** 
 – I denna roll fungerar du som stöd till kunden exempelvis beträffande integrationsstrategier, analys av befintliga system, och val av tekniker. Du designar och definierar den övergripande integrationsstrategin och arkitekturen, och tar hänsyn till långsiktiga mål och effekter av integrationsinitiativ. Du hjälper även till att sätta principer för integrationer. Du leder ofta ett team av integrationsspecialister och är involverad i implementeringen av lösningar. Här vore det bra om du har djupgående kunskap inom integrationsdomänen, teknisk uppsättning av plattformar och integrationsmönster – helst med fokus på molnbaserad integration.
   

  

 Vi jobbar främst med molnbaserade plattformar eller ramverk i molntekniker som Azure, GCP och AWS. Det är därmed meriterande om du har kunskap i DevOps, IaC, infrastruktur och nätverk. Några av de tekniker som ofta används i våra projekt inkluderar bl.a. Boomi, Workato, Azure Logic Apps, Azure API Management, Software AG (webMethods).
   

  

**Karriärbanor på Solita**
 Jobbet som konsult hos oss innebär ofta en brant utvecklingskurva och variation sett till både arbetsuppgifter och roller. Vi ser karriärbanor inte som en specifik trappa utan mer som ett landskap med flera möjliga individanpassade orienteringar, både i höjd- och sidled, inom ett flertal kompetensområden.
   

  

 Sam jobbar exempelvis idag som People Lead parallellt med sin roll som Service Delivery Manager.
   

  

 Lia har haft chansen att bära många hattar under sin tid hos oss – från developer till lead developer och arkitekt i både lokala och gränsöverskridande integrationsprojekt.
   

  

 Andrei har också utvecklats väldigt brett som scrum master, team/tech lead, SDM, arkitekt, projektledare och kravställare i ett större projekt de senaste 3 åren.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss. Vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

* Meningsfulla projekt: Arbeta i en agil miljö med varierande uppdrag där du kan påverka teknikval och arbetssätt för att skapa de bästa lösningarna
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete med flextider– läs mer från vår blogg.
* Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra medarbetare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
* Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom systemintegration, cloud och utveckling


 Utöver detta får du även ta del av följande
 **förmåner** 
 :
   

  

 💰 Fast lön oberoende av beläggningsgrad
   

  

 🏦 Pensionsavsättning i linje med ITP1 samt möjlighet till löneväxling till ditt pensionssparande vid inkomst över 8,07 inkomstbasbelopp
   

  

 🛋️ Möjligheter till flex för en god work-life-balance
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 🩺 Sjukvårdsförsäkring via Skandia för både din mentala och fysiska hälsa som täcker dig även utanför tjänstetid
   

  

 🏋️‍♀️ Friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr via Benifex (tidigare Benify).
   

  

 💻 Ett brett nätverk av erfarna specialister från olika områden inom tech att samarbeta med
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

 Vilka är vi?
   

  

 Solita är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2000 medarbetare i 9 länder, varav 230 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

**Intresserad av att höra mer?**
 Låter det som en spännande utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team som ligger i framkant inom systemintegration. Om du har några frågor, hör gärna av dig till Head of People & Culture Patrik Rafstedt (patrik.rafstedt(at)solita.se); People Lead Sam Odeh (sam.odeh(at)solita.se) eller rekryteringsansvarig Kajsa Törnroos (kajsa.tornroos(at)solita.se).
   

  

**Hur ser processen ut?**
 I rekryteringsprocessen tror vi på en gedigen och effektiv process. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Om vi ser en potentiell matchning, bjuder vi in dig till ett första möte för att lära känna dig och berätta mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar på Solita. I andra intervjun fokuserar vi på din tekniska kompetens och din erfarenhet. Om allt går bra tar vi oss vidare till sista steget där vi presenterar ett erbjudande och välkomnar dig som ny Solitan!
   

  

 Under sommaren kan vår återkoppling dröja något längre än vanligt. Vi hör av oss senast i augusti. Tack för din förståelse och ha en fin sommar!
   

  

**Din arbetsplats kan vara belägen i Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö.**
 Sign up to our newsletter to hear about the latest news, upcoming events and open positions at Solita

title: BI Developer
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes more than 150 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

 Are you passionate about transforming data into powerful insights that drive business success? We're building a world-class Data and Business Intelligence (BI) function to empower our organization with data-driven strategies. Our team is at the forefront of developing a global data platform, pioneering data enablement practices, and delivering impactful BI solutions across the company.
   

  

 We're seeking a Business Intelligence Developer to join our expanding Data & BI Team, with a special focus on the Swedish market. In this role, you'll collaborate with data engineers, our Data Enablement Lead, and local stakeholders to create impactful Power BI solutions that enhance decision-making processes. You'll help shape our data usage across Swedish operations, transforming raw data into valuable insights that drive performance, transparency, and growth.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Craft and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports to support both operational and strategic decision-making in the Swedish market.
* Work closely with stakeholders from finance, operations, and commercial teams to gather requirements and translate them into insightful data visualizations.
* Guarantee the accuracy, consistency, and reliability of BI solutions through thorough testing and validation.
* Enhance existing Power BI reports for improved performance, usability, and clarity.
* Collaborate with data engineers to ensure robust, scalable data pipelines that align with business needs.
* Utilize the Global Data Platform (GDP) to enable insightful and actionable reporting.
* Support the Data Enablement Lead in advocating for BI best practices and encouraging user adoption across Swedish operations.
* Contribute to boosting data literacy and self-service capabilities within the organization.


**Who You Are**
 You possess strong communication skills, enabling you to effectively engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Your detail-oriented nature and proactive approach to problem-solving and solution design make you adept at working with complex datasets, translating them into clear and actionable business insights.
   

  

**Experience**
* 5+ years of proven experience in BI/data visualization disciplines.
* Demonstrated experience in Power BI development, with strong skills in DAX, Power Query (M), and data modeling.
* Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts and dimensional modeling.
* Fluency in Swedish is required.
* Experience in property, real estate, or service-based industries is beneficial but not required.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software
   

  

 #msl

title: Test & Verification Engineer
description:
Sii Sweden is looking for experienced Test & Verification Engineers to join projects focused on life-saving medical technology. You will support the development of advanced healthcare systems, ensuring product quality, safety, and regulatory compliance. As a part of a multidisciplinary R&D team you will contribute to system-level testing, exploratory testing, traceability, and automation efforts.
   

  

****Your tasks****
* Plan and execute system- and integration-level tests based on product requirements
* Design test cases with traceability to requirements and risk analysis
* Perform exploratory and formal testing of embedded systems and connected devices
* Automate selected test cases using Python or equivalent scripting
* Use tools such as HP ALM, DOORS Next Gen, and LabView
* Support documentation, defect reporting, and verification compliance
* Collaborate with developers, QA, and regulatory teams across disciplines


**Requirements**
* Degree in Engineering or related technical field
* 2–5 years of experience in verification or QA in complex systems
* Familiarity with regulated industries (e.g. MedTech, automotive, aerospace)
* Hands-on experience with Python and test tools
* Experience with requirement tools like HP ALM, DOORS
* ISTQB certification or equivalent test process knowledge
* Fluent in English and Swedish


 Job no. 250709-U3JAP
   

  

**Benefits For You**
 Solid financial situation

 Contracts with the biggest brands

 14 authentic core values

title: Senior Backend Developer (Python)
description:
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a skilled
 **Senior Backend Developer (Python)** 
 to join our R&D department at Tacton.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll help shape and deliver backend solutions that are critical for Tacton’s
 **CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote)** 
 platform. You’ll contribute to building performant, scalable, and maintainable backend services using modern tools and practices. It’s an exciting opportunity to make an impact, grow your skills, and help shape how data drives value for our customers.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Design, build, and maintain robust backend services using Python
* Develop and support APIs, asynchronous workflows, and data pipelines
* Refactor legacy components and enhance system performance and reliability
* Contribute to architectural improvements, tooling enhancements, and test infrastructure
* Ensure production-ready, well-tested, and clean code
* Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects, and cross-functional teams to align solutions with business needs
* Foster a collaborative and forward-thinking team environment


**Our Tech Stack Includes**
* Frameworks & Libraries: Flask, SQLAlchemy, Alembic, Pydantic, Pandas
* Asynchronous Processing: Celery with worker pools for different task types
* Datastores: PostgreSQL (RDS), Redis, Amazon S3, ClickHouse
* Infrastructure: Deployed on AWS
* CI/CD: GitHub, Buildkite, Docker
* Code Quality: Black formatter, MyPy static typing
* Testing: Pytest (unit/integration), Jest (for async APIs)


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in backend development
* Deep expertise in Python and cloud-based asynchronous architectures
* Strong knowledge of relational databases, SQL, and data-centric libraries (e.g., Pandas)
* Experience developing and maintaining APIs in a SaaS environment
* Dedication to writing clean, testable, and well-documented code
* Ability to work independently and take initiative
* Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)
* Comfortable working on-site 3 days per week


**Who You Are**
* Passionate about building reliable, scalable backend systems
* Collaborative by nature and thrive in team-oriented environments
* Comfortable taking ownership and leading technical decisions
* Detail-focused and committed to code quality
* Curious, open-minded, and adaptable to evolving tools and technologies


**Preferred But Not Required**
* Experience with ClickHouse or other modern columnar databases
* Familiarity with reverse proxies like Gunicorn and Nginx
* Understanding of frontend technologies (React/Redux/TypeScript)
* Experience with Docker and CI/CD pipelines
* Strong documentation habits and ability to explain technical topics clearly


**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Cultural and background interview with Global Talent Acquisition
* Business interview with our Hiring Manager
* Interview with an internal partner
* Peer meeting
* Reference check


**What We Offer**
 At Tacton, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in a global organization that values teamwork and individual development. Working with cutting-edge technology, we tackle complex challenges in the manufacturing industry. We offer flexible working conditions, knowledge-sharing, and a culture built on mutual respect and collaboration.
   

  

**Our culture and why you belong**
 Collaborative, Engaged, Trustworthy, Customer-Oriented, Visionary—if these values resonate with you, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 At Tacton, we celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome. Our team consists of people from all over the world, and we believe this diversity makes us stronger.
   

  

 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we’re committed to fostering an environment where everyone can thrive. With our comprehensive onboarding program, you’ll be set up for success from day one.
   

  

 We look forward to your application—apply soon as we review candidates on a rolling basis.
   

  

**About Tacton**
 Tacton is a leading Software as a Service company trusted by global manufacturers. We got started in the late 1990s when six computer scientists figured out a revolutionary way to help manufacturers overcome their most critical product configuration challenges. Since those early days, we’ve grown to support global manufacturers seeking to thrive in a changing world.
   

  

 Learn more about us at: www.tacton.com/about
   

  

 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Embeddedutvecklare till försvarsindustrin
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vi söker en C++-utvecklare inom inbyggda system som kommer ingå i ett av våra kunders projekt inom försvarsindustrin. Projektet arbetar inom avdelningen för flyg. Här kommer du att:
   

  

* Arbeta mycket med programmering i C++ i Linux-miljö.
* Migrera stora delar av källkod till mer modern standard.
* Porta mjukvara på hårdvara som sitter på VxWorks-plattform.
* Underhålla, uppdatera och vidareutveckla äldre mjukvarufunktionalitet.
* Det tillkommer även en hel del nyutveckling för att anpassa mjukvaran till hårdvaran/plattformen.
* Interagera med kund, köra testfall, utvärderingar och diskutera idéer framåt tillsammans (resor kan förekomma).


 Om teamet:
   

  

* Ett socialt och trevligt team på cirka 10 personer, där alla åldrar och erfarenhetsnivåer finns representerade.
* ScM-inspirerat arbetssätt med en team lead och en Jira-board – men utan sprintar.
* En arbetsmiljö där du uppmuntras att ta egna initiativ och inte vara rädd för att söka hjälp.
* Stor möjlighet att interagera med andra team och samla information där den finns


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi tror att du:
   

  

* Är en C++-utvecklare som trivs i en Linux-miljö.
* Har ett par års arbetslivserfarenhet som utvecklare
* Gillar att analysera och förstå befintlig kod, även när dokumentationen saknas och den är skriven i en äldre version av C++.
* Är social och bekväm med att kommunicera med andra team och experter.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska.


**Meriterande kunskaper**
 Det är ett stort plus om du även har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* CMake
* Jenkins (främst att använda, men även att konfigurera flöden)
* ADA95
* Tidigare erfarenhet från militär/försvarsindustri


 Denna tjänst är säkerhetsklassad, vilket innebär att en säkerhetsprövning genomförs i enlighet med svensk lagstiftning om säkerhetsskydd. För att uppfylla kraven i säkerhetsprövningen behöver du som kandidat bland annat inneha ett medborgarskap som uppfyller dessa krav. Om du innehar dubbla medborgarskap så krävs att dessa medborgarskap är inom en nation tillhörandes EU eller NATO för en godkänd säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Hos AFRY får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en inspirerande och innovativ miljö där du kan växa både professionellt och personligt. Vi värdesätter våra medarbetares trivsel och erbjuder en trygg anställning med bra förmåner. AFRY har ett starkt fokus på kompetensutveckling och vi erbjuder både interna och externa utbildningar för att du ska kunna fortsätta utvecklas inom ditt område.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder även:**
* En trygg anställning med kollektivavtal och konkurrenskraftiga löner.
* En flexibel arbetsmiljö med frihet under ansvar och balans mellan jobb och fritid.
* Möjlighet till personlig och professionell utveckling via AFRY Academy eller externa kurser.
* Tillgång till Club AFRY med aktiviteter som skidresor, yoga, kultur- och sportevenemang.
* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där våra ledare stöttar dig i din utveckling och där innovation och samarbete uppmuntras.


 Kontaktperson för frågor:
   

  

 Maja Lindqvist
   

  

 Recruitment partner
   

  

 maja.lindqvist@afry.com
   

  

 På grund av sommarsemester kan din ansökan komma att hanteras under augusti.
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

description:

title: Senior Android Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Android Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Design, build & scale high-performance mobile applications using Jetpack Compose.
* Collaborate and participate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features across both platforms.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organisations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.
* Drive and lead Android projects. Be able to oversee a team of Android developers, define standards, and manage team deliveries.
* Able to either work closely with, or take part in solving problems on other platforms like iOS, cross-platform and more.
* Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends to ensure our apps are cutting-edge.
* Having a deep understanding of the mobile deployment pipeline.


**Who You Are**
* You're an Android developer (with 10+ years of experience) and a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognising the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.


**Are You Ready to Shape, Ship, and Scale with Us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Cloud Sales to evroc
description:
Are you a driven, high-performing cloud sales professional who thrives in high-activity environments and wants to be part of something big from the ground up? Join Evroc – and help build Europe’s first sovereign, sustainable hyperscale cloud.
  
About evroc At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud. Location: Stockholm Job type: Permanent position The Role evroc is in a critical growth phase and is currently building its sales organization with a focus on mainly the Swedish market with future expansion across Europe. Earlier this spring, the company hired a VP of Sales, and you will work closely with this person to shape the sales strategy, processes, and commercial structure.
  
As a Cloud Sales representative, you will join at an early and exciting stage, playing a key role in laying the foundation for the company’s commercial success. Your primary focus will be identifying, contacting, and closing deals with private sector customers – and eventually expanding internationally. You will have significant ownership of your pipeline and are expected to work proactively, with the phone being one of your most important tools. You thrive in a fast-paced environment with clear targets, where hard work is recognized and rewarded.
  
evroc offers you a unique opportunity to sell Europe’s first sovereign, sustainable hyperscale cloud – a future-defining product that is reshaping the digital infrastructure of Europe.
  
Skills We Value We’re looking for someone who is ready to put in the work required to succeed – and who’s excited by the opportunity to help build something big from day one.
  
This role is tailored for someone who is customer-centric, fast-pace, doer and a team player. Our current phase demands a hands-on, high-activity mindset where speed and hustle make all the difference. Desired qualifications
  
Has minimum 5 years experience in sales within cloud services, with strong business acumen and excellent in guiding multiple parallell customer through transformation projects
  
Tech-savvy and comfortable discussing how to solve customer challenges through technology
  
Experienced in supporting customers in complex compliance conversation
  
Is a driven hunter with a strong track record of sales success
  
Thrives in high-activity sales environments with a strong focus on volume and outbound calling
  
Is confident working independently, taking full ownership of their pipeline and closing deals
  
Speaks and writes fluent Swedish and English (a must, as you will be calling and meeting customers across Sweden)
  
Is willing to travel several days per month to meet with clients
  
Wants to take part in building a sales organization from the ground up, working closely with our VP of Sales
  
  

evroc offers We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
  
At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
  
Applicants must possess a valid work permit.
  
We look forward to your application! The recruitment process is managed by Ed: Za Group. If you have any questions regarding the position or the process, you are warmly welcome to contact us at charlotte.hoffstrom@edzagroup.se.

title: Commercial Manager
description:
Är du en kreativ och analytisk person med starkt självledarskap som vill förstärka vårt team med dina tankar om hur vi kan utveckla affären med våra företagskunder? Då kan rollen som Commercial Manager på Telia B2B affärsenhet Medium and Large vara rätt för dig.


Jag heter Kristina Carlsson och ansvarar för erbjudandeportfölj och kommersiell agenda för våra medelstora och stora företagskunder på Telia. Jag letar efter en Commercial Manager för att stärka vårt team kring affärsanalys, styrning och kommersiell agenda inom segmentet.


**Är det här din nästa möjlighet?**

Som Commercial Manager är du centralt placerad och driver affären i starkt samarbete med våra säljkanaler, produktledning, teknik och marknad. Du utvecklar vår affär med skarpa strategier och tydliga operativa planer som ger konkreta resultat levererade direkt till vår affärsledning.


Ansvarsområdet för tjänsten kan variera över tid men kommer att innefatta Business Networking-området. Du kommer att få en nyckelroll i att driva tillväxt inom affärsområdet, med fokus på erbjudanden som Bredband, Cloud VPN, DDos skydd och Telia Edge Security.


Rollen inkluderar men är inte begränsad till:


* Regelbundet granska och bedöma affärens framsteg och dess ekonomiska resultat (P&L).
* Skapa och implementera precisa finansiella prognoser och planer för att vägleda affärsbeslut.
* Formulera och genomföra kommersiella strategier och planer som driver omedelbar och långvarig affärstillväxt.
* Förbättra och expandera utbudet av tjänster, med fokus på affärsutveckling av områden som säkerhetstjänster.
* Identifiera och fokusera på viktiga utvecklingsprojekt, och övervaka introduktionen av nya tjänster och avvecklingen av andra.
* Formulera och kommunicera värdepropositionen för erbjudandet, samt prissättning och prismandat
* Nära kontakt med säljkåren (AM, KAM och specialistsälj) runt om i Sverige

**Vem är du?**

I den här rollen krävs att du tar initiativ och driver aktiviteter för att Telia ska förtjäna att vara en av kundens viktigaste affärspartners. Med en tydlig kommersiell kompass och ett kommunikativt ledarskap kan du engagera nyckelpersoner och samarbetspartners, säkerställa en sund affär och samtidigt ha en förmåga att ligga steget före och inspirera och definiera om en affär där förändringstakten bara ökar.


Dina egenskaper och din erfarenhet bör innefatta:


* Du är självgående och har ett starkt självledareskap
* Flera års erfarenhet av kommersiellt arbete och affärsutveckling
* Du har god kommunikationsförmåga och kan agera informell ledare
* Du har en stark analytisk förmåga och arbetar datadrivet
* Erfarenhet från Telekom/IT-området
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska
* Relevant akademisk examen

Det är även starkt meriterande om du har erfarenhet från tidigare roller med kommersiellt ansvar, management konsult, projektledare med stakeholder management eller liknande roller.


**Telia är mer än bara en arbetsplats**

Med oss kommer du lära dig av skickliga kollegor över internationella gränser, och du kommer att ansluta dig till ett team som gör varandra starkare och världen bättre genom att lösa utmaningar. Vi är stolta över vår vänliga atmosfär där människor är entusiastiska över sitt arbete. Vi trivs på vår mångfald och strävan efter att leverera bra produkter och extraordinära upplevelser för våra kunder. I en värld där valen är oändliga, om du vill göra verklig skillnad, är detta en plats där du hör hemma. Förutom en attraktiv och inkluderande arbetsmiljö erbjuder vi en flexibilitet och ett brett utbud av olika förmåner.


**Ansök och bli en del av oss!**

Om du är intresserad av att bli en del av vårt team – tveka inte att ansöka!


Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Talent Partner Christine Wilén på christine.wilen@teliacompany.com .


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! För att säkerställa att dina personuppgifter hanteras på ett säkert sätt ber vi dig att ansöka via vårt rekryteringssystem. Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot CV:n via e-post eller liknande.


Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Under processen kommer nödvändiga bakgrundskontroller att genomföras.


**Welcome to Telia – Join us and make better happen!**
